reviews: There are plenty of good restaurants within a walking distance such as La Tequila, La Mantera, La Alcachofa to name a few. A great shopping center devoted to shoes. The only issue that we experience is the noise on weekends from the roof top bar across the avenue which can last until 3 AM. On the facility, they need to have better window locks since it is quite risk if you have children

This hotel sucks.. I called downstairs for Internet problem and told me this was an outside problem.. And can't be fixed.. Then A/C was down most of the time..! After the second time I called they wouldn't answer phones.. Breakfast staff was really nice tho!

This hotel is like a youth hostel, nothing works and everything smells, I booked a suite (room 204) and as I enter the room I thought it was pretty nice, but as tI settled in it showed its true colors, the AC didn't work properly, the internet was down (called the reception 3 times and everytime the same answer "It's an outside problem") the shower curtin smelled like an old wet rag, the breakfast looked so bad I only eat a couple of cookies. Totally avoid this place

Service was not bad, staff was nice, but the hotel has several issues: the safety box was not working, they did fix the problem after a long wait, we noticed on our last day the door to the hall would not close until after several attempts so you don't realize anyone can enter your room and steal your belongingd. Our room had no windows, which is really depressing.

Everything about this hotel was great, rooms, views, location, service and breakfast was included!  Great access from the street and close to many good amenities including the shoe mall!  Will definitely make this my hotel of choice when visiting Guadalajara.

Well located but one of those hotels that leaves you with a bitter sour taste in your mouth. The rooms are ok in size and the place could be much better if only they would upgrade it just a bit. Sincerely, I would rather stay in another place if I could have a chance. The breakfast is lousy. The service is OK. The rooms need an urgent ipgrade and the amenities and room comfort are barely ok.

I stayed 2 nights in this hotel for my business trip. It has a quite good location in the city. And the room is really great. The room is exactly similar with the pictures on the website. The bell boys are well trained. Also, there are some good restaurants around the hotel and also an OXXO. Really recommend this hotel.

Since we only stayed there the one night after arriving in Guadalajara, we didn't check out the ammenities.  Our 9th floor king room was spotless with a comfortable bed and great shower in the bathroom.    Liked the valet parking included and found them efficient at retrieving our vehicle.  Numerous restaurants within easy walking distance but since we were there on a Sunday night, we found many of them closed quite early.  Nice bakery (Goiti's) just up the street to get morning rolls if one is so inclined.

Walking nice and safe area, close to Plaza Mexico, and many wonderful restaurants, I love "La Matera" argentine food, just across the street. La Tequila is nice restaurant and Tintoreto, nice Italian food.  The rooms are ok, with a nice view of the skyline. I had new towels, and a bed with new sheets, very cozy. Very friendly staff, the breakfast after 9 is not so good, (they  do not refill the traits with the good stews). Gym is small but comfortable.  I like it, you should try it.

Room and interneet were OK. Breakfast was average. Very friendly staff. Good mexican (Jalisco food) at 10 min walking distance. Couple of mini markets 2 min walking distance. 30 min from the airport on taxi (280 pesos, I don't remember the exchange rate). Conference room (small to mid size, other available) worked well, no noise, not too bright for presentations, food was close.

Uber doesn't have the correct information on this hotel and tries to drop you off half a block from the door and on the wrong side of the entrance. I could not connect to the internet with either my phone or my laptop My partner could connect and the internet was very very slow Rooms are big  Bed is comfortable They have a safe in the room Good location You can hear the music of the clubs near by until around 4 am in the morning. They did provide ear plugs but for some reason only provided one pair.

Spent one night here. The room was great with a huge king size bed. Breakfast for 2 people was included. Everything was fine. The guy is very limited but ok. The breakfast was good too. Recomendable..

Admittedly, we initially chose this hotel based upon proximity to the dentist and its reasonable room rates.  Certainly, this is to be classified as a business hotel but the adequate sized rooms and comofrtable king beds are quite good.  One can experience a few clues that things are geared to the single executive traveler such as the number of towels, glasses and coffee cups but these are all workarounds!  Fact is that we find it to be comfortable, quiet and priced right for our typcal one night stays.

Great location! Right on Av. Mexico where there are a ton of places to eat and typical mexican food (antojitos). It is not a downtown location but you can take a bus or cab and your anywhere in 10 to 15 min. We had breakfast in the hotel and it was good, the staff was very kind and helpful with directions and recommend places to go and eat.

nice room with comfortable beds, no noise, good neighborhood with plenty of restaurants around. They provide a buffet breakfast with a good variety of items. A couple of hot choices, make your own waffles, fruits, toast, cereals. Friendly staff at breakfast, tip the waiters!

A friend recommended we stay at this hotel, he has clients who stay here. So as a family travelling with grandparent, mum and dad, and infant son we occupied 2 rooms at this hotel.  The hotel is modern, rooms were exactly as pictured and quiet. Staff were courteous. The buffet breakfast served a good selection of food, with the waiting staff providing extremely good service, also helping entertain our 18mth old son while we settled into to eat each morning.  A laundromat, and a pharmacy are only a short 5 min walk down the street, for the ladies a shoe mall is a short walk away also.  The hotel has a number of upmarket restaurants near by, La Tequila provides great take out if you have little ones that can't stay up late.  We enjoyed our stay here, and will come again.

The staff was always very helpful and friendly. The breakfast very good! The room comfy and nice. We spend 4 nights, the location was very convenient, close to the malls, and the shoe plaza, also good restaurants, that ares of Providencia neighborhood is very nice.

We enjoyed our stay again.  We had a huge room that allowed our 2 young ninos (2 and 5) to play with their holiday toys and still have enough room for us to not be tripping over each other.  Grandparents occupied 2 other rooms.  A big shout out to Raul at front of house for all the tourist suggestions you could ever ask for. Great bonus to have a employee with excellent spoken english and insights to where to go and maybe not to go in the great city of Guadalajara.

Personally, the service is excellent, but this time my vote is for the pirates, the service is incredible and Jack Sparrow is an excellent Cheff, I remembered being at home. I will be back soon guys and I will keep your good attitude and excellent energy, distinguish them ...

It was an excellent service and the best breakfast, recognition of the pirates team and the capital jack for their good seasoning, we will return to the same hotel. He was always smiling and attending with a pleasant attitude and spreading his good energy

I thoroughly enjoyed the delicious buffet items. We were met by the offer of a cup of orange juice as we sat down. All of the food was very good, hot food was hot. Highly recommended. Thank you, Pirates of the Caribbean, especially Captain Jack.

We stayed for 5 nights at this hotel.  Clean, quiet and safe are my expectations.  Hotel Ejecutivo Express met all 3 of my requirements.  In addition the breakfast was delicious.  Front desk staff was courteous (and they spoke English).  Room was clean and well kept to date.  This hotel was walking distance to several restaurants.  Uber was the way to travel to and from the hotel.  We were part of a wedding guest group of 20 people.  Everyday at 4pm we congregated in the lobby and outside seating area for conversation and drinks.  Marco ran the room service and bar area.  He worked his tail off running up and down the stairs to accommodate our needs.  We tipped him well for his services.  He was very pleasant.  I highly recommend this hotel

This is a very clean hotel, our room was nice sized and clean. Bed was nice and maid service daily. The hotel staff was very friendly and spoke english. Price was a little high compared to cost of other things in the area.  Only downside was the noise level, the walls are very thin and there is a gap under the door you can hear anyone in the hallway. Also lots of traffic and music outside that we could hear all night. I'm a light sleeper so that is a problem for me, but otherwise nice hotel.

For nearly two years, I've stayed at this hotel since it first opened. It has fixed its initial problems with the internet. I highly recommend this hotel. It's extremely good value in a great location. The rooms are very comfortable and nicely decorated. The bathrooms are great: very clean and excellent water pressure. This will continue to be my GDL hotel.

We arrived on a "Red Eye", so we were at the hotel early.  The staff made every accommodation to get us an early check-in so the family could rest.  From the front desk to the housekeeping staff, everyone went out of their way to make our stay special.  Daniel and Victor helped arrange tours for us.  The on-site restaurant was reasonably priced with good food and service.  The rooms were super clean and nicely appointed. The location is just a few blocks from the main pedestrian plaza and historic sights.  There are plenty or great restaurants nearby.  This property is an excellent choice for a visit to Guadalajara.

We were extremely impressed with this property. Based upon the price, we were expecting to encounter some disappointing components...but such was not the case. Excellent location, sophisticated feel, clean with a nice decor, and an extremely professional staff. Extra nod to concierge Victor...most helpful and pleasant to deal with.  Rooms are typical of this type of hotel, which is to say small-ish but well designed for good functionality. The breakfast buffet was quite good as well. Highly-recommended.

Great modern clean hotel. Staff is helpful and go above and beyond expectations to provide excellent service. Large TV screen in the rooms. Comfortable beds. Shower a bit small but adequate. Gym has a great view. Restaurant needs improving. Awesome location 3 blocks from the cathedral and Degollado theater. Excellent value.

Oso txukuna, merkea, baina terrazan ondoko gelak oso zaratatsuak dira gauerdira arte. - Very clean boutique hotel, but rooms close to the terrace are extremely noisy sometimes until midnight on a school night.

We got in around 1am, starving and exhausted. Not knowing Guadalajara is a known as the City with small town hours, everything was closed. However, Humberto, our hotel host and greeter, went above and asked his friend to open his restaurant and served us a late dinner. For the 6 nights we stayed there, Humberto and the concierges became our reference points for places to visit and food to taste, but most importantly provided amazing services on the daily.The hotel is small, but beautiful with a chandelier and papel picado as you enter, a unique little art gallery near the elevator, and tributes to Frida throughout the hotel- a plus always! So, although there is no pool I'm incompletely pleased with the cleanliness and attention here- I can go to the pool anywhere.

I loved every single detail of this hotel, very modern, clean and big room with and incredible location. Our baby boy loved the tv with Netflix the staff is very nice and attentive. This would be our got to hotel in Guadalajara from now on.

This was a diamond in the rough of a hotel. The staff were all excellent. The rooms were awesome. The breakfast was cheap and also great. There are too many things to list, but overall I highly recommend this hotel.

The Real Maestranza is a new hotel that got it right. The hotel is beautifully designed - modern, luxurious with attention to detail. Rooms have great bathrooms and very comfy beds, great wifi and even have netflix and cable TV. The staff is amazing (never seen such consistent competence and high levels of service) and always willing to go above and beyond to make sure you have what you need (they will even make taco runs for you late at night!). For example, they have 2 shifts for their concierge office so there is always someone to help you with plans. The location is excellent, just a short walk from the City Center and to top if off the rates are incredibly reasonable.  The breakfast was good with full buffet as well as reasonable a la carte options as well.  This hotel

At first glance HRM appears to be a modern, newly refurbished property that is, until you look a little closer:  Took a shower, the towel has holes in it the diameter of my finger.  I went to hang the towel on the wall hook provided, the hook fell off the wall, I'm only in the room an hour at this point and things are breaking; the credit card key works when it wants to after 3 or 4 tries.  But there needs to be some perspective here, the staff are friendly, informative, helpful and most seem to speak English well.  The price is right, U$71.  The location's smack in the heart of the city center within easy walking distance of most of the touristania.  So, the place is held together with old twine and wallpaper paste, it's not like I'm buying the room or anything:  the toilet

This is one of THE nicest hotel rooms I have ever stayed at. It was beautifully decorated, spacious and incredibly modern.   The hotel staff was nothing but nice - even recommending local restaurants that we should try.   I was so impressed and satisfied with my stay and would definitely return when I make a trip back to Guadalajara.

arrived in the evening tired to this hotel from Puerto Vallarta. registered it in advance. in the end, my booking was canceled for some strange reason, citing that there was not enough money on the card but this is not so !! and it was proposed to spend the night one night in a nearby hotel, although the rooms in the hotel were.  booking.com also had confirmation and there was no cancellation from the side! Documents at the reception to me about the cancellation I, too, no weeks! I had to call the customer support service myself and ask to be canceled for them. Since I could write off the money for either the entire period of residence, or a fine.  I did not get any apologies from them, this is very sad

The hotel is modern and tastefully decorated, just 5 minutes from ‘el centro historico’.  Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable. We opted for the buffet breakfast as part of our deal and were glad that we did, as it was well-stocked and tasty.  The staff were very friendly and helpful. Price was good. Highly recommended!

The hotel is very clean, modern, and has an OUTSTANDING staff.  it is situated in a very walkable area in Central Guadalajara.  Specifically, I would like to recognize our wonderful bartender “Ernesto” for going above and beyond to provide excellent service for both nights we visited the bar.  Additionally, our room was immaculate...completely spotless!  Thanks to our housekeeper “Ampello” (probably misspelled - young gentleman) for being so thorough to ensure a very comfortable room experience (stayed in #314 Jan 25 to Jan 27).  Unfortunately, the buffet breakfast was not so good.  The food in the serving trays was kind of cold and, frankly, didn’t taste very good.  There was also two TVs blaring old Mexican TV shows and it was hard to have a conversation at the table because

Mexico has always had a negative stigma to its name due to the uneducated media from the United States. If you really want to get to know Mexico and Guadalajara, Real Maestranza is the place to stay.   Comfortably adjacent to Calle Maestranza for which it gets its name, you can find not only the most friendly of staff, a team of eager concierge, a what should be award winning restaurant and classy bar. If you are not one of the faint of heart, you’d most definitely enjoy the gym on the last floor with a stunning view of the city.   From the moment you enter the front door you will be greeted with a feeling of New York service from the most friendly of Bell Boys. Arriving to the mostrador you’ll find the staff already know you by name and have all of your check-in paper work

Just spent a couple of days here...and one of their best assets is their Concierge, Victor.  I don't speak Spanish so he made all of my arrangements from getting me from the airport to recommending how to get to sights in the area...a great couple of days.  Thanks!

We had a wonderful 3-night stay at this hotel in January  prior to our visit to Puerto Vallarta. This stylish hotel  has a lot of modern and classical arts in the  lobby,  including an art  gallery. It is located in the quiet heart of the historic district and within  a few minutes walk to a handful of local restaurants nearby and about 10 minutes walk to the Cathedral and the square. We were given a 5th floor room facing a parking garage the first night and I requested a change of room due to the noise from the open stairway and was happy with our new room.   Most staff there were very pleasant but they don't  not speak fluent English. However, Victor, the general manager, speaks fluent English. We wanted to get a taxi to explore Tlaquepaque, an old historic, artsy suburb the

A mixed bag here.  Rooms are great, new and clean.  Lobby is welcoming, lovely art in the courtyard.  Wifi is useless, just forget about it.  Concierge staff tried very hard to be helpful but were not helpful with even basic things.  For example, I asked for a map and was given a map of Jalisco state.  I persisted and finally got a map with printing so small and street names unreadable.  I stopped in the nearby Holiday Inn where I got a proper map.  Concierge could not name a single close place to go for lunch, just seemed flummoxed by the question.  They were very nice and really trying to be helpful.  But overall they could not help with basic questions.   My biggest issue here is the area.  After dark feels deserted, very creepy, apparently this is how it is downtown.

Hotel room beautiful. Bathroom shower terrific. Location excellent.  Definitely get the breakfast buffet  Most of all the concierge and front desk people incredibly helpful.   Look no further! This is the place to stay!

Awesome hotel with great staff. Awesome rooms with great location downtown. One of the best I ever stayed in. Highly recommended!!! The bar was really nice. Located down the street from awesome restaurant: La Chata

My friend and I spent 2 days in the beginning of September. The hotel was beautiful and the location is perfect to visit Guadalajara. The staff all went out of their way to make sure our time was memorable. A very special thanks to Victor the concierge, Andres our driver to Tequila, Dave and Gustavo in the restaurant and a very special thank you to Octovio in the bar. If you are visiting Guadalajara and need to stay near Centro this has to be your choice. Also thank you to the wonderful housekeeping team member who called downstairs before I was even out the door telling me I left my phone in the room. 5 star customer service.

Great memorable and excellent 4 night stays at this hotel with friendly and hard working staff: Victor Navarro and Daniel Lara, concierge guys, went beyond their duties getting coordination transport to and from for us, soccer(footbal) tickets, and Tequila places to visit,...Andre came picking us up at the airport at 12:00AM, at the end of the football game of Chivas vs Atlas, and drove us to the airport safely. Other hotel personnel was attentive to our sojourn. Room was always clean and beds were made daily. Hotel location is near Cathedral and walking to different points of interests. This hotel met beyond our expectation that we didn't expect; we will return there in future and we recommend it based on our experience.

We came as a group of senior citizens to the Real Maestranza in 2018 and again in 2019. We love this hotel. Rooms are great and reasonably priced and the price includes a wonderful breakfast. The 2 concierges, Victor and Daniel helped us in so many ways including things to do, transportation, tickets, and restaurants. We had a wonderful time and in 2018, we stayed for a week, visiting Tlaquepaque, Tonala, Guachimontones, Tequila and Ajijic. Victor and Daniel assisted with our plans for all these activities. The manager of the hotel, Angel also was wonderful and helpful to our group. We are from California and Guadalajara is about 3 hours flight for us and it is not expensive. We felt totally safe. Because the dollar is very strong against the Mexican peso, Mexico travel is a

Overall this hotel is great but the concierge was nit at all helpful!  Not sure his name but he’s bald with glasses.  I’m not sure he knows what a concierge is suppose to do for guests.  We asked about the Guillermo del Toro exhibit at the UdeG and his answer was tickets were sold at the box office of the theatre.  I was shocked!   Any other concierge would’ve asked if we wanted tickets and would’ve offered to get them for us as that what a good concierge does!  Needs some training.  Susana in the restaurant was a gem!  The WiFi is the worse we’ve had on our two week trip; we had better WiFi at a beach club in Huatulco then we’ve had here.  There are 5+ networks in this hotel and none of them work well. We were constantly having to log-in to another network!!!!

This is probably one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in! The staff here are super nice and helpful, they don't hesitate to go out of their way to make things better for you. The concierge is extremely helpful and nice, he offered many tours and things for us to do around in Guadalajara. I especially like how it's close to the center of town and everything's close by. The restaurant staff is also very nice and the service is amazing. Both the concierge and the restaurant staff helped my family set up a surprise birthday for my step dad and we were extremely satisfied and thankful for it, especially to the concierge who went out of his way to get the cake and everything set up for us.

It was a great experience to stay at this hotel. this was my first time  and will not be the last. the customer service was Great. Victor Navarro was one of the first to greet us at the lobby and offered cold water right away. the room I selected was not available but they upgraded me to a better one and gave me the option to go back to my original room the next day but they also offer for me to stay at the better room. Victor will see us come down almost every morning and he will make it a point to talk to my daughter. on the last day my daughter said lets go look for my friend so I can say goodby. over all everybody was good, rooms 100% clean. recommended

A gem of a hotel, a 4 star experience. Each room was clean, large, and the beds were oh so comfortable. The lobby and art gallery were a plus. The gym with complementary water and towels were a nice touch. The staff was personable from the front desk, the bell hops to the concierge.   The hotel's central location made it easy to explore the rest of the city or grab a quick uber ride to where-ever we wanted to get to. Excellent restaurants located within walking distance.  A true hidden gem.

I stumbled upon this gem of a small hotel in the historic Centro a couple of years ago, and it has since become my “home” on my frequent visits to Guadalajara. The staff is super friendly and helpful, especially the concierge Daniel Lara. There are only a dozen or so rooms on each of the six guest floors. The rooms themselves are modern, larger than those in many hotels, well appointed, and feature very comfortable beds. I love the rain-forest shower heads in the bathrooms. The corridors on the guest floors are carpeted in order to minimize noise from other guests passing by, which is one of my pet peeves. The buffet in the restaurant offers a changing selection of tasty dishes. If you are looking for good value and a relaxed, friendly atmosphere in downtown Guadalajara, Real

Clean, safe, and well priced...The staff are all terrific. I don't know all their names, but the concierge, Daniel, has helped me many times...I really have found nothing to complain about at this hotel... I gave it an excellent rtng because they deserve it

Let me start by saying that this hotel offers a good value for its price. Of course, don’t expect too much at this price, too. The reason it gets one star is because of its way of handling business. It’s a common practice in the hotel industry that a second guest is not charged extra unless parties of two needs to be fit in a larger room. In fact, when I booked the room on Orbitz, this hotel charged a same price for one guest and two, and they are still doing it as of today. However, when I arrived at the hotel with my friend under a one-guest reservation of a king-bed room, the front desk demanded $150 more for the second guest. I asked if this was because they needed to move us to a large room, a manager-like person said “you get what you booked.” And they didn’t offer extra

I am an expert on Mexico having lived there on and off for 32 years. If you are going to Guadalajara and want location, fantastic service, updated rooms, a boutique style hotel with character, and serious attention by the staff, Hotel Real Maestranza is the place for you!  I own a company that guides Americans through Mexico and this is the  hotel for my clients when in this beautiful city.  A big shout out to Cristian in the sales department who went above and beyond for me and my guests, standing in line for over an hour to score impossible tickets for a temporary exhibit we wanted to see.  The attention from the concierge, Victor, and the girls at the front desk, management knowing who we were and making sure we had everything we needed, and the staff in the restaurant taking

Just a few points: View from our room was if a multi-story concrete parking lot. We were there for Day if the Dead and would expect the concierge to have been able to direct us a bit. Very friendly but what little information he gave was actually incorrect. Replacing some towels would be nice but not essential. Doormen and waitperson all very welcoming. And the drivers are so nice and excellent drivers—plus reasonably priced. Excellent housekeeping.

My wife and I stayed here in October 2019. We were greeted by the concierge Victor. He was so kind and helpful in helping us plan our Tequila tour, getting a rental car, pointing out places to visit, and finally a ride to the airport!   The whole staff was top notch, friendly, and got us whatever we needed. Room was clean, new, and modern with comfy bed and big TV. WiFi worked flawlessly. Breakfast was worth it, yummy and fresh! Great central location too, near shops, restaurants, cathedral, etc.  Really time and money well spent. I would recommend the hotel.

This is a solid 3 star hotel.  It is located just a few minutes walk from all the Centro highlights.  The rooms are well equipped and the staff attentive.  The Consierge staff give great advice on where to eat and what to do.  The hotel has a number of drivers at very competitive rates.  I arranged to have one pick us up from the airport. Was really nice to be met at arrivals and at 290 Pesos I believe it was a screaming deal.

The first room they gave us was right above the bar.  There was loud thumping all evening and late into the night.  They said there were no other rooms available and it would be over at 11pm but it wasn't.  They have bright purple lights shining up to light up the hotel at night but they come right into your room.  Since the blind is very thin it is very bright and it makes it hard to sleep.  With the noise, the bright light, and the air conditioner failing, it was hard to sleep.  I paid for a "room with a view" but that was just of a parking lot.  The next day we were able to move to another room to try to get away from the noise but it was an internal room with only a window facing the lobby!  The lobby had bright yellow lights which caused a similar problem with the thin

Stayed there for Valentine’s Day weekend and we love it! Great location in the center of Guadalajara, and very safe for tourists. The rooms were very clean and everything worked perfectly! Would definitely recommend and will stay there , the staff is very professional and friendly, very attentive to your needs.

Absolutely loved this place. The staff was amazing, very helpful and cordial. Will definitely stay here again. Highly recommend! Buffet isn't too bad, especially for the price but there's a lot of delicious places to eat around the area.

Stayed in the hotel for a couple of weeks . Rooms were always clean . Staff was hands down the friendliest and most helpful we’ve ever encountered . Concierge Victor helped us rent a car and book plane tickets . One of the best stays I’ve had in a hotel ever .   Would definitely stay at The Real Maestranza again !!!

This hotel is new and close to the historic center and Cathedral.  There is a noisy street in the front so ask for a room facing the side or inside.  The room was clean and comfortable but there is a flaw in the design of the hotel.  The doors to the rooms slam very loudly and since the people across the hall came in and out numerous times it was hard to sleep. There is no free breakfast but there is a restaurant with a paid buffet.  Daniel, the concierge, was very helpful in giving us information and obtaining bus tickets to Guanajuato.

Truly not enough words to recommend our hotel stay. My friends and I were well taken care of throughout our entire stay. Super clean and super close to everything. I can see why my friends keep staying here!

The staff went absolutely above and over any expectations. Victor from concierge is amazing, Daniel was very helpful as well, the bartender Ernesto was so nice and attentive, and christopher in the lobby was so helpful, all in all they  were absolutely amazing!! they assisted in absolutely everything. I can not be more thankful! The staff assisted us in getting foods, treated us like royalty in all honesty. I have been to this hotel 6 times now, and the service never disappoints!

Daniel, the  Conceiger does a great job . All of the Conceigers know there information , very helpful .The front desk was easy check in and easy check out. The staff was fabulous  . Worth the trip . To anyone reading this  , stay here .thanks

We have stayed at many, many hotels in this country. And not a lot of hotels offer help in situations when they don’t have to help you. But this hotel does. Thanks to the concierge Mr. V. Navarra, we were able to fix some problems after our bag was stolen in the city center. The staff in this hotel has been exceptionally friendly and helpful. The mix of being professional, authentic and helpful was sublime! Definitely worth booking this hotel when you’re in Guadalajara.

We couldn't have been more pleased with our rooms at Real Maestranza.   We were two couples killing a night in Guadalajara before taking an early flight.  Check in was easy.  The rooms were clean and fresh.  The air conditioning worked well and the bed was so comfortable.   I loved the simplicity of the bathrooms and the very cool hexagonal tiles behind the mirrors.  Nicely done!!!  Great blinds, sheer, semi-sheer and  full light blocking options.  The service was very kind and attentive.  They arranged our taxis and gave us water.   Great people!!!

We had a very last minute reservation back in February as we wanted to see the Lucha Libre round the corner. The room, foyer and location of this hotel are all 5* but what made it stand out for us were the staff. They were so incredibly helpful - finding somewhere to park our van since it was too big for the car park and giving lots of useful advice for GDL. Cannot recommend highly enough. Hopefully be back!

As others have mentioned in reviews, concierge guys Victor and Daniel go above and beyond as does the entire pleasant staff. The hotel is modern and rivals most premium US chains.  Our room was modern and clean.  The gym had a good variety of Cardio equipment.  When I booked the hotel I did not realize how central it is, just a few blocks to all the Centro sites.  We went out numerous times in the evening and the neighborhood always felt safe.  The hotel restaurant has very good food, we ordered room service, many times, got their pizza, chicken cordon blue, omelettes and chicken Caesar salad all were superb, inexpensive and no room service charge.  I would put this hotel in the same category as a Hyatt or Hilton. I could not be more happy with the hotel and the staff!

Overall our stay at this hotel stay was fine, but as we were getting ready to leave, we realized cash was missing from our locked room safe.  We had no choice but to report this to the management, but they have denied it could have happened so therefore we must be wrong.......but we still have money missing. I  just feel that future guests should know what happened.

This a really nice place to stay . Rooms are clean and nice . The staff is really attentive. Since the moment you walk in they greet you with a smile and treat you great. We live in Los Angeles and we forgot our phone In the room we stayed in . Staff member named Daniel did everything in his power to get us our phone back . Daniel was beyond helpful in getting us our phone back that we left . I recommend this place to anyone who is going to Guadalajara. We definitely will stay here next time we come .

We arrived very early in the morning, and the hotel was kind enough to store our luggage and get a room ready for us by noon, free of charge. The room was clean and nicely decorated. Very much appreciated the black out mechanical curtains. no issues with this stay whatsoever. The hotel is a few short blocks from the Cathedral, so it was very convenient to the sites and restaurant, but just far enough away that it was not noisy.

We were treated great here.  Daniel and Ivan were the best.  The restaurant  on premise has good food at very reasonable  price.   Room service  was fast and inexpensive.   Bartender  was wonderful  and made great suggestions.   We bought bottle of circularo tequila  from showroom

We stayed 5 nights here, it was a very clean hotel and nice stay. Victor was over the top friendly and took care of all of our needs, Victor as the Consiere made the stay amazing and the hotel is centered in Guadalajara with easy access to the train that takes you all through the city. I would give him and the hotel five stars, completely recommend staying here while in town.

We had such a lovely stay in this charming hotel.  The beds were super comfortable, rooms were large and the amenities were great!  A special shout-out to Concierge Christopher who sorted out tours and shopping for us.  We were lucky to have Andreas tour us around Tequila and airport drop off.  Huge thanks to all the staff for making our stay so wonderful.  Tip: take advantage of their Happy Hour in their Mezzanine- amazing mango mojitos. Gracias! Mary Lou

We were in town for a wedding and stayed 3 nights at Real Maestranza.  The hotel is in a good location for exploring the historic center, the rooms were new and clean and the staff were very friendly and professional.  The breakfast buffet served in the morning was plentiful.  We would stay here again.  Nice hotel for a very good price.

Flawless. This is now our favorite hotel in central Gdl. Beautiful modern rooms, friendly staff, great location. Free indoor parking — that is hard to find in Centro!  Restaurant in lobby is very convenient. Tip: room service prices are best I’ve seen at a hotel of this quality.

Perfect location. It was a block from Centro, all the plazas, markets, churches, museums and even the clubs that are so special in Guadalajara. The hotel was small and intimate with very friendly staff. The concierge, Daniel Lara was excellent and genuinely friendly. All in all a great hotel. We will be back for sure.  Disliked · Nothing. I liked everything. It was all good. Great service from the reception, restaurant staff, to the housekeepers. FYI- This review is delayed as the actual trip occurred on December 2019, just before the pandemic.

Service was marvelous! Top notch care 24/7! Staff is above and beyond and make sure you are well taken care of. The hotel will provide you with transportion upon request and the kitchen service is oustanding, delicious food! Everyone is so nice and happy to help you! Best experience!

This is an Excellent hotel.  The Service was wonderful.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  The Rooms are modern and clean. The Restaurant was good.  The Location is awesome.   Very convenient.  Free underground parking. Cost was very reasonable.  Highly recommend.

I have stayed here before and enjoyed the stay and service. Covid has changed things. During the check in they wanted my credit card I used during booking. During the trip down to GDL a money belt was used. I excused my self to the room next to the lobby to retrieve credit card. This took less than 2 minutes. After returning to the desk a new line had formed and had two wait in line of 3 people deep. During check in they split the 2 nights booked into 2, 1 night. Stays this increased paper work and confusion even thought it was booked with one reservation code. After checking and unpacking had dropped about $100 USD in Mexico pesos when getting my credit card. I was told multiple times they would look at security cameras but they never did. Excellent hotel!  The staff is amazing and welcoming . It’s very clean, comfortable, and close to el centro.  We will be staying here again!   I have nothing else to add, but apparently, Trip Advisor insists on 200 characters.

Excellent experience. We enjoyed a very smooth and cordial check-in, from the moment we drove up to the parking entrance.  Attractive, well-located for our needs (La Marcha del Orgullo) and very reasonably priced. Would definitely stay there again.

Amazing hotel !!! Rooms are stylish, comfortable and well appointed. Location can’t be better, amazing restaurants, tourist hotspot?! You name it. Will hardly stay here again. Stay if great but no One speak English here. In all honesty, you can’t expect everyone to speak English, you’re in their country learn Spanish or use a translator.

Everything about this hotel is wonderful. The decor, the staff, the cleanliness, the comfy beds, the central location.  All great, EXCEPT for the funky smell in the bathroom, which wafted into the room. The bathroom has no window, no exhaust fan, no ventilation at all. At least incense sticks should be provided to clear the air in the bathroom. We will probably stay here again, but next time we'll bring our own incense.

This hotel is a great value. The rooms are well appointed, very clean and attractive. The staff has been very pleasant. And, there is free secure parking. There is a concierge and he was quite helpful.  The only downside to the hotel is that it's a little off the beaten path.

The location was perfect! It is located near a lot of the main tourist attractions. La Avenida Chapultepec is only a 10/15 minute cab ride away. The customer service was amazing! Everyone was super friendly and accommodating. They have drivers who work for the hotel and whenever I was ready to go hang out at night, a staff member would contact a driver. If they didn't have any drivers available, he would call a taxi and would confirm the price with me so that I could make sure that the taxi drivers weren't trying to get over on me.   As far as the room, everything was almost perfect. I had a hard time getting out of the bed in the morning because it was so comfortable. I felt like I was sleeping on a cloud!   The negatives: The bathroom was nice, but super small and they layout

Real Maestranza Hotel was outstanding all around. You must stay at this hotel! Highlights include: - Central location - Surrounded fantastic, tasty, and affordable local food options - Highly accommodating, friendly staff - Beautiful premises and on-site artwork - Great hotel restaurant (El Chato). Eggs made ready to order during breakfast! - Room service most of the day. Food was extremely high quality (quesadillas con champignon, alfredo pasta con pollo) - Amazing value for price

Truly, this is a 2-star hotel masquerading as a 4-star hotel, which is why its clientele consists largely of ghetto nouveau-riche Mexicans and empty-headed bourgeois drips from Mexico and Latin America. I stayed for some ungodly long period of time (ten nights I think) and leaving the hotel was like being released from a minimum security prison -- a hell hole with NO soundproofing, inconsiderate maids, and a largely do-nothing management. It's the noise that is the most objectionable (I complained several times and nothing got better), and the noise occurs throughout the day and throughout the night. The worst times are from roughly 11am - 4pm (when the maids clean the rooms and play their fiesta music and turn their ridiculously loud walkie-talkies on), and then from 6pm - 10pm

Real Maestranza went above and beyond our expectations. Very clean boutique like hotel. Great location and excellent service anything you would expect at a 5 star hotel. Really enjoyed our stay and will recomend to friends and family. Good value but most importantly you feel that you are being taking care of. Thank you to Daniel and Christopher the concierges.

The room was sparkling clean and huge, the front desk staff was friendly and very professional, The neighborhood is safe and You’ll find a lot of variety of restaurants in a walking distance, I highly recommend this hotel.

The hotel was a great place to stay and be near the center of the city. With great food, great views of the city at night and not too far from the historic center of Guadalajara. A hotel with a very classy modern look and rooms that are very comfortable.

Good:  New/clean property, location (close to restaurants/bars/etc)...  Bad:  Service/staff, onsite restaurant, room amenities, "pool", gym, parking  First day/check in fiancé noted they had a no smoking policy in all rooms.  However, upon going into our room it was noted that there was a heavy smell of smoke/other chemical scents to mask it.  Requested a different room which they did accommodate.  Settled into the new room, which was nice/clean, albeit an IKEA like quality of aesthetics.  The fridge is extremely small so putting any leftover boxes from restaurants is not possible.  Its really only good for drinks and that is it.  The Nespresso type coffee maker was the biggest perk of the room as it made excellent espressos/coffees.  The first day we needed to head to the

I stayed for business, the hotel was clean and staff was warm as Mexico's great standard. The hotel's location is a standout: with great international food restaurants by walking distance. Situated on Lazaro Cardenas, the main highway, makes getting around very easy anywhere you might want to go in Guadalajara. Remember to go to Catedral and Tlaquepaque!! You wil enjoy it a lot!

We stayed here for 3 nights. Room looks fine and was clean (coffee amenities were not so clean though). But the whole vibe of the hotel wasn’t there. They try, but it did not appeal to us.   Also, the second night we had to switch rooms at 11pm, having to pack all our stuff, because the airconditioning was broken (it could not be switched off and our room was a freezer). I mean, it can happen, but it was really annoying and we did not get a formal apology.   During breakfast and dinnertime the room smells of food, so somehow it comes up all the way to the 10th floor even. And it was very noisy, of course from the high way that it’s right next to, but also loud music coming from I don’t know where.   We only did breakfast (which was included) once, we did not enjoy it very much

STAY AWAY! the service is by far the worst, showers don’t work, phones don’t work, we have to come down to the reception to place food order but then they forget to put it in... they are not organized at all! Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else!

This hotel has an awesome value. They pay so much attention to details. The bed was super comfortable. They check the room immediately after check-out to see if you left anything behind.   One of my best experience with a hotel.

We stayed at Hotel Baruk for ten days during the Christmas holiday.  Not one hiccup occurred: the concierge at the hotel had coordinated our transportation from the airport to the hotel prior to our arrival; our rooms were beautifully appointed; the hotel's weekend breakfast buffet was wonderful as was their lunch, Lebanese focused and prepared by their Lebanese chef; and, the staff is very friendly, including the valet who went out of his way on New Year's Eve to purchase gatorade for my daughter who was ill.   The hotel's location is a standout: Chapalita, the hip neighborhood, with great Argentine, Chinese, Italian and seafood restaurants, is within walking distance.  The mall, Gran Plaza, is a few blocks away as well.  Situated on Lazaro Cardenas, the main highway, makes

I had an amazing experience here, the staff was super helpful ( especially Liz, Quique, and Chapiz). The rooms were very clean and comfortable. I would definitely come here again in the future! Great service!

From the time I entered your hotel, everything was great. The greetings, the smiles and the warm hospitality. It’s a great compact hotel. The breakfast was very traditional Mexican and the gym was awesome.  At the breakfast, the staff were very accommodative and they tried their best to assist you.   I will definitely come back and strongly recommend this hotel.

It is not your generic and boring hotel. Great comfort, excellent service and attention, clean and modern rooms, the free buffet breakfast offers plenty of different options including chilaquiles, eggs, beans, stew, waffles, fruit, yogurt, bread, etc   Staff members are always happy to help and Very kind.

My fault for not actually reading the reviews but this is the first time I have been led astray by Tripadvisor.  How this is the number 1 rated hotel in Guadalajara is a mystery.  It is simple, basic, on a busy road and poorly constructed.  We left in the middle of our stay and moved to another location.    If you were here for one night and you needed to be close to the hotel I could see staying here but for any other reason there have to be better options.

Great hotel with amazing things to do, it's near the city center and connected to every corner against Guadalajara.  This hotel have amazing food and great beverages all around the place. The bed was so cool and the view amazing around the property

Great place with amazing food, the place is located near one of the most popular places in Guadalajara, if you don't hace a car is easy to find buses and cabs around the corner.  The environment is so peacefull and i really enjoy my time there

The rooms are really nice and comfortable.. the facility offers free Wi-Fi and a gym. Workers are very friendly it also included a breakfast  and it was delicious I would recommend a 100% the location is on downtown of guadalajara

Stayed at hotel Gumont with the family and had a wonderful overall experience. The breakfast buffet was delicious and the service was excellent. I would recommend staying the night here and enjoy the hotels amenities

Great place to spend the night, delicious breakfast and nice views of the city of Guadalajara. Clean rooms and excellent service in general. Recommended going alone or with family. Location is really good.

This is a brand new and very attractive hotel in a good location.  The rooms and common areas are quite nice, comfortable and clean.  But the hallways are very narrow and the doors are not sound proofed.  I expect a bit of noise in a hotel, but I do not expect to have to hear every conversation in the hallways as if it was taking place in my room and I should not have to listen to the music from the room across the hall with both doors closed.  I also can't recommend room service.  I understand that things get busy, but there is no way on earth that it should take an hour, two phone calls, a third call that rings 12 times and a trip to the front desk for a ham sandwich.  Which I ended up cancelling because I would have been too tired an angry to eat it or enjoy it.  I regret

The front staff were very professional and efficient. The rooms were beautiful and the maid service excellent. Each room has a balcony but you can’t use it because they fear someone will jump off???? The restaurant was forgettable!! The waiter had no knowledge of wines. He pored the smallest glass of wine I had ever seen and charged for a full glass. The chicken oriental rice dish was a GLOB of dark coloured salty rice with chicken- vegetables were lacking. I WOULD  return to this hotel for the room and nothing else!

We were in Guadalajara on business and Hotel Velvet was the perfect ending to every day. The staff were friendly and helpful, the breakfast buffet was interesting and delicious with something for everyone, and the rooms were clean and air-conditioned. The rooftop pool is awesome and boasts a great view of the city!

We stayed here for a couple of nights when we first landed in Guadalajara before our AirBnB was ready. The hotel is really inviting and clean, the rooms were well set and quite large, with floor to ceiling windows giving you a nice view, if you happen to get a room facing out the front.   Breakfast was extra in the mornings but a good selection was available including omelettes and pancakes as well as an array of juices and hot dishes.  Staff were very good in directing us for places to eat locally and managed taxis for us into the town too.  It is a bit of a walk from here to the centre of Guadalajara but an Uber ride was only around €5 for a car.  There is an outdoor pool but I didn't get chance to use it, but heard it was really nice, bar the noise from a building site next

- From the beginning even over the phone, very attentive and kind  - Expectations exceeded  - Great location - Totally renovated - Great taste and decor  - Room was not too big, however it was perfect for my Husband, our little girl and I, we even request a crib and it was fine - Staff all kind! - 100% clean, it looks that they are attentive in each detail, we did no see even a dusty corner, perfection! - AXEL & FELIPE, thank you! :D keep the that level of service and do not loose that smile  - Whatever the Executive Office and Management is doing, is perfectly working, congratulations !

A very nice, clean and quiet hotel in one of the best parts of the city.   I paid only $75 for two nights, so it was a steal. Very close to numerous restaurants. Front desk staff was courteous, the breakfast buffet is filling and only around $8. I will definitely stay at Velvet Plaza again

We stayed at this hotel on our way back from Puerto Vallarta to the USA.  We've stayed in other hotels in Guadalajara and they've always been nice, but this is our new favorite.  The rooms are a bit small, but very clean and have what you need.  There is a small balcony, where two can sit and look out over the city.  The location is good, with a mall and cinema next door, also, many restaurants in the area.  It's a very walkable neighbor.  The staff is welcoming and most seem to speak English.  This is a pleasant and very reasonable hotel.  We will definitely be back.

I usually stay a block away from here, but this became my new favorite immediately. Andrea and her staff accommodated every request I had. In all, they left an amazing impression and I’m definitely coming back!

This hotel y bran new and very modern. It is located close to almost every where you would want to go while in Guadalajara and a very safe neighborhood. I would walk back to my room from the bar at night nothing bad happened and police were constantly patroling around the area. The staff is great. Esequiel gave me excellent personalized service. He suggested near by restaurants, tours and he even let me check in early because I arrived earlier than expected. I would definitely stay at this hotel when I go back to Guadalajara.

Can not recommend this hotel more.  Jose Rosales could not have been a better server. Wonderful. Great atmosphere. Lovely wine - definitely try the Pinot Grigio. The bar looks onto the main street. Lovely and quiet.

It's the first  time that I had been to Mexico and Velvet gave me a very brilliant experience! Such as home sweet home! The food of their restaurant is also so delicious!!!! And the devices are so great especially the pool! And it really really cheap! So everyone can use a little money to earn a lots of fun! Thanks to all the employees in here, especially Miriam, Sandra and Hannah

The service is super good, and all of the waiters and waitreeses are nice! And I make so many true friends in here! Velvet makes me feel I'm home! And the breakfast is really delicious, that you might don't want to miss it! Thank you to my friends Fernanda, Juan Pablo, and Axel

This was my second time staying here. I stayed 6 nights. Same affordable, clean and nice. I stayed on the second floor, I attempted to get a higher floor but they said they were full. I was concerned about noise but it was never an issue during my stay. I had difficulties with Wi-Fi the first day but resolved itself the second day. There were issues with the television but was due to the rain. I would stay here again, can't beat the price and perfectly located!

the hotel is a 4 stars high level class, the rooms are very clean, the hotel opened just one year ago, so facilities are pretty new. the registration process was very fast. Hotel has a great location, very close to many restaurants and bars.

I highly recomend staying in the velvet hotel at guadalajara. Reserved via expedia for $800 pesos!! Super cheap,so we didn't know what to expect.  The location its in one of the most important avenues in the city,so you have a lot of things around. There's a mall just next to the hotel (centro magno), and a wings restaurant. Also there is a convenience store (oxxo) and lots of other things nearby. I think this location is perfect for tourists, since you have the centro historico nearby, but also you're not that far from other neighbourhoods. The check in was fast and easy, the lobby its very airy and pretty with big comfortable sofas. There is parking space for no cost and underground (safe!). The room its very good in size, and with modern decoration. The shower is amazing!

Traveling for business, stayed only one night, the hotel is really good.   Rooms are spacious and clean, bathroom works well, comfortable bed and pillows.   Staff is attentive, there is free WiFi all over the place.   The venue of this hotel is excellent, walking distance to the Minerva, a shopping mall, pharmacies and places to eat like a local.   For the price payed, it’s an excellent choice to stayed in Guadalajara.   Definitively book again here if needed.

Mi experiencia fabulosa, habitaciones limpias, amplias, todo super. My experience just great, clean rooms, big, comfortable and very good location. ready to come back. The employees very educated and friendly, nice view. Easy to go every where

Very good and well located hotel ! Close to Chapultepec, Gran Plaza, Los Arcos, ... Nice and clean room with a great view (Street side)  Sauna and swimming pool.  Regular breakfast.  Very good value for your money !

We spent two nights at the Hotel Velvet Plaza.  It's a very modern hotel with a central location.  We had a great room with a king size bed.  With tax the room was about $52/night.  From my experience, in the US this room would be at least $150/night.  The TV (we never used) was huge.  The bathroom was lovely, with a great shower.  The king bed was very comfortable.  The staff was very helpful, although only a some, not all spoke English.  They have a driver they can arrange for you, or they will call you a cab.  They had a breakfast buffet available for under $8 USD.  Lots of fruit, custom eggs/omelets, cereal, French toast, pancakes or you could order by item.  Staff was very kind and helpful.  There is a stairway to enter the hotel, but there is an elevator in the building.
Had dinner our first night in the hotels restaurant downstairs and it was so lovely. Our server Jose Rosales was super kind and attentive. Made sure everything was okay, and we were comfortable. 👍🏽.

While this hotel is not in the Centro Historico it is situated in a very lively and walk-able section of the city.  The staff is friendly and helpful.  The rooms are clean and new.  There is a roof top pool and gym. A restaurant, we did not eat here.  We loved the new and clean feel of the hotel, great wifi.  We walked around this area extensively and found many bars and restaurants.  Many shopping malls and shops.  I prefer this area to centro because of the walk-ability.  So if you have seen the sights in Centro and are looking for a different neighborhood this is a great place to stay.

Well,so I was planning my trip to revisit Guadalajara since 2004 .I read some reviews on hotels and come across Hotel Velvet Plaza. New, excellent price ,some good comments and a good view on Youtube due to its great location. I stayed for eleven days at this wonderful hotel and yes,it´s all true. Great service , great restaurant of its own, terrace pool with a great view and a gym.Best of all,the price. No downside here. And a tip : Use Uber for everything, can´t beat the service . And the city ? Well , it will take you a month to view all the videos praising the city . But you have to be there to really appreciate it.

A very central hotel which has all the facilities a traveling work person could require. Very pleasant staff who always try to help in all situations. Good room service which arrives quickly. Good location for restaurants.

Very comfortable, well-located hotel in Guadalaja. Excellent staff: kind, helpful, & professional.  Restaurant serves good food, too, especially the few mexican dishes listed on the menu.  Room is comfortable with a nice balcony and comfortable bed.  My only complaint would be that he air conditioner cannot seem to cool down the room enough on very warm days.  The hotel was probably built before climate change became such a problem and who could have anticipated the heat we have now? Very satisfied though.

The only reason this is not a 5 star is perhaps because of its size. It has it all, very understanding management and excellent staff throughout. The food in the restaurant is top drawer including their breakfast buffet. It is brand new and reminiscent of top hotels i found in Asia for the same great price. You can book here with complete assurance. Gerard Farand, Tumbler Ridge, BC, Canada

I am staying here now, and this hotel has already exceeded my expectations! The front desk was very friendly and checked me into my room immediately. The room itself is spacious, and it has a safe and a huge tv. The pool area is a nice relief for the hot weather. Definitely recommend staying here!

A couple of years old Hotel, well equipped in general Hotel.  Rooms are clean, modern, small with great bed mattresses.  The problem I personally found was the lack of sound proofing of the rooms, a lot of what your next door neighbor watch, does among other things can be easily hear from room to room specially at night, or when stroll down the hallway looking for your room.  Personally, I will consider this not the best for families but otherwise a good inexpensive and modern Hotel.  Lastly, parking small, good location with an OXXO and a Pharmacy within 100 ft away.  Hotel personnel are friendly but front desk at night is short handed, so if you patient and don’t mind your neighbor to make noise in the middle of the night, this maybe the best deal for you.

Nice hotel in a great location. Brand new, clean, and the location is perfect. Guadalajara is a nice city, one of the best in Mexico. This area is safe. Absolutely recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.

My husband and I currently staying at this hotel. We booked a 3-night stay. While we normally select a hotel around the Histórico Central area, we decided to stay in a different location for a change of scenery. Hence the reason we selected to stay at the Hotel Velvet Plaza. BIG MISTAKE...  We arrived in the morning prior to the standard 3 p.m. check-in so it was not a surprise when we were advised that our room was not ready. A couple hours after we ate breakfast at a restaurant next door, we inquired again whether any rooms were available.   The front desk agent informed us that she could check us in early for a fee 500 pesos. Under normal circumstances, I would have contested the fee, but because we were exhausted from taking the red-eye flight the night prior, I begrudgingly

We spent 3 nights in the hotel. It’s in well located area. The rooms were a little small but very clean and comfortable bed. Only downside was they do not have refrigerators in their rooms or an ice machine. Their pool was really nice, they have clean showers, steam room and a little gym. The staff was great! They helped us plan our trip to Tequila. Whether it was a taxi, dry cleaning or just advice on where to have dinner, they were right there ready to help. I will definitely return.

Just returned from a weekend stay at this hotel and it was flawless. Incredibly friendly and helpful staff, spotless accommodations and common areas and the breakfast was outstanding and underpriced. I've had some rough stays in Guadalajara in the past and this will be my go to hotel for the future stays. Within walking distance to many wonderful dining venues and other attractions! Bravo!

Pros: safe location, all new hotel, nice staff, modern, 20 min away from downtown.   Cons: hotel is new so there's things that have to be worked out: whomever designed beds did not factor the bottom of bed sticking out to far. Entire family hit themselves with bed box at least 3 times during our stay. Also staff says hotel taxi price but driver charges a lot more. This needs to be addressed  between taxi and hotel. I asked for more pillows and waited over 3 hours only to be told they didn't order enough for entire hotel. There's also a limit of 4 towels per room?! Ummm why?? If you want to charge $130 a night for GDL then you should be able to ask for extra towels. Hotel room phones stopped working so I had to shower and go downstairs to order room service. This hotel opened recently and is really not ready to operate. First and foremost, there was no water in the morning. When I went to ask for some bottles of water for basic needs, I was given only one 300 ml little bottle and was told that they have access to no more bottles. The staff has no training to give customer service at all. No discount on hotel fees was offered. It has a noisy club just in front. With so many hotels offering a better experience, do not bother with this one.

Couldn't ask for more in a GDL hotel.  Extremely well located in a nice central neighborhood near  Chapultepec entertainment district.  Nicely designed modern rooms with nice bathrooms.  Excellent wi-fi.  Starbucks cafe in lobby.  Very friendly, warm service.  Felt totally safe walking around.  A great addition to GDL hotel scene!

What a great new hotel in a great area of GDL. Beds very comfy. Pillows and comforter awesome. Rooms not real large but more than comfortable. Great patio in front with many bars and rest in neighborhood. Right across street from mall.

From check-in to check-out what a wonderful hotel experience. I have nothing negative to say about this hotel.  The room was nice, clean and cold like I like it. The staff was friendly, professional and helpful. The hotels location is clean & quit.  Taxis is readily available right outside the hotel lobby. Walking distance (around the corner) to bars and restaurants.  We walked to the Arcos Vallarta Guadalajara at night was beautifully lit purple as well as the Minerva.  We walked back from Chapultepec Avenue (must) after dinner as well as Santo Coyote Restaurant (must).  There is also a Mall across the street and yes there is a Starbucks inside.  Highly recommend this hotel

We booked on bookings.com or hotels.com hour and a half later came went to the hotel and made us sit down and wait they said they haven't received the reservation only person that really made us feel comfortable and really took care of us was Martin the doorman maybe he should be front desk manager this is the only reason I'm giving it a four star because of Martin

We have stayed at this hotel numerous times and it has become our new favorite when traveling to Guadalajara. Located in the center of the Minerva district, there are abundant restaurants and things to do. Across the street from the Central Magno, you can shop and see a movie just steps away. The pricing, service and cleanliness are very good and the beds/pillows are very comfortable. The first few times, I didn't realize there was parking underneath the building. There is also a gym located on the first floor. It is somewhat limited, but at least you can get a quick workout!

Very nice small hotel, well located with a mall just across the street, and nice restaurants and coffee shops around. Very nice people at the front desk and very good service. Great option for business travel.

Booked a basic room at a cheap rate(about $80.00 US dollars, tax included), arrived to hotel and was upgraded to a suite! Loved the suite and loved the view from our suite! Suite was kept very clean!  Would definitely stay here again!

I stayed there for more than 2 weeks in July 2016 and was very impressed. It's a brand new hotel and the rooms are spacious and well appointed. The service was very friendly and the breakfast buffet was also quite good.   The location is also good as it close to many of the best restaurants in Guadalajara, and also just across the road from Centro Magno mall.   Unfortunately I made the error (in hindsight) of making multiple bookings since I had to extend my stay multiple times. Some of these bookings were direct with the hotel and some were with an online booking channel. This led to some confusion with the billing when I checked out. But the management - with the help of Israel at the front desk - were helpful and eventually we managed to sort out the discrepancy. I can

We checked in late for a one night stay after traveling all day. The staff was friendly and helpful; clean rooms and comfortable beds. We didn't eat at the restaurant located between the checkin and the elevators but it looked cozy and welcoming. They even gave us s 10% discount card for your first consumption in the Bar Urban. The location in Minerva is across from Centro Magno, central to many of the amazing restaurants down Lopez Cotillo. We will return!

nicely remodeled and clean, great service. very cozy beds. price very accesible for quality and valuing distance to Centro Magno shopping.  bottle of vine in the room as courtesy - very nice touch. This is the second time staying in this Guadalajara location.

We had 7 rooms with 14 people last weekend. Mario Ortiz, the food and bev mgr was amazing. What a guy. So accommodating and pleasant man. Thanks so much Mario. The hotel staff is great and this hotel is in great location. It is only about a year old, and everything is new and fresh and nice. The beds are wonderful.

We checked in,,helpful front desk,very nice.They asked if we wanted an indoor room or one with view.Said it could be a little noisy.Little did I know the music would go to 4.00 and next night 6.00 am.They were very helpful in getting me an indoor room as I was bleary eyed.Service at the restaurant other than a girl there,cannot remember her name was not great.Toast cold,greasy omelet,and slow.The great thing about this hotel is the location,many restaurants and mall across the street.They tried to do everything right,but the restaurant staff need better training I would say.Clean etc.Getting ice for the room took a while ,then came in very small container.lolI would stay there again,not eat there,and now know what to expect.Rooms are very nice.

First time here and I was quite not sure, but the price was very competitive; it has a small on site parking without a daily fee, that certainly its a plus. Rooms are about the size you need, nothing more, nothing less, big lcd tv with cable, free wifi and a daily free small water bottle. The restaurant has a good menu or buffet, it depends on your appetite, but food its good and not that expensive. They have a small bar/coffee area with and outside patio, if anyone wants to breath clean air. Overall service, staff and location its very good, I will come back next time Im in town.

Everything was really nice, rooms and public areas, the bed was extremely confortable, the only thing is that the walls were very thin and I could listen to every single thing that was happening next room, for example if a brush fell into the floor.

I just wish this kind of hotels where more common... the architecture design, decoration of lobby and room and the modern services where perfect. I was happy to find usb outlets all over the room, next to the bed, in the desk... Wifi was fast... free parking... a nice small Starbucks in the lobby and just a cross, a shopping mall (a bit old but with great movie theaters).  The gym was small but perfect for a fast and simple workout.  Cons:  Some of the rooms look inside the hotel.

Very good location. Nice service. It has parking lot which is very convenient. Walking distance from good restaurants and just in front of a small shopping. Starbucks coffee service inside 24 hours. Good option for business but also for vacations

Very well train staff at all levels, recently renovated the entire facility, clean and spacious rooms. contemporary deco. Good location, nice restaurantes at walking distance. Very good value I deffinitely would stay here again

We stayed at this hotel for the second time. We walked in and the front desk immediately knew who we were. They welcomed us as though we were coming home. At breakfast the next morning Mario who runs the restaurant welcomed us with a big hug. Enrique, the head chef couldn't have been any nicer. Staff is great including Ellie who cleaned our room. This is the place we will always come back to in Guadalajara.

We stayed here only for two night but definitely I would like to stay more night.  We had a small issue in regards of the cleaning of the room, but I have to say that Fabiola and Carlos the manager were prompt in their response in order to  compensate the issue.  One small thing in regards of the room service menu, I order a plate of berries with yoghurt, but they brought watermelon, cantaloupe and papaya with plain yogurt, no granola no honey, nothing. And in my opinion a little high priced for that kind of fruit with less than a cup of yogurt.  Definitely I WILL return every time I am in Guadalajara.  This hotel has a great location, the design is very appealing to the eye. As an architect is nice to see something different in hotel design.  The staff is great from the bellboy

This hotel has only feather pillows so, if you are allergic make sure to ask to the manager to change them, they have low maintenance on them, really bad! Breakfast buffets quite small, salty and fatty food, make sure your room has no door between the next one, you can hear everything, is just one small bad installed and thin door.

Nice hotel, clean, well appointed room, all the usual modern conveniences.  The hotel staff were very helpful and spoke perfect English. My only complaint is that the towels were rough and frayed around the edges.  Also there was essentially no information in the room about the hotel (for example the hours and menu of the restaurant) or the surrounding area.

there is nothing to express regarding negative impression. the reception was excellent and the environment very clean. the personnel is very kind and polite. I would recommend the place to others and wish to stay at one of your resorts.

This Hotel is on a great location, if you are looking for an affordable and nice experience this will be your best choice. Their staff is very friendly and their breakfast buffet is the best ever! Look for Pablo and Rogelio they are very hospitable. My Mom and I enjoyed our hospitality during our visit.

Recommended for pleasure or business. Great location adjacent to Glorietta Minerva and Centro Magno. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby. Sweeping city views from upper floors. Nice restaurant with pleasant service.

Located just across the Centro Magno mall, this hotel is a great option if you are un Guadalajara for business. It is very near the Americas street area, which is filled with bar and restaurants, but is very easy to move around Lopez Mateos, Vallarta or Mexico Avenue. Rooms are modern and new, and they have minibar and a Lavazza Coffee Machine. Staff is very well trained and willing to serve.

The room was spacious, the restaurant was fine (the service wasn't!) and the desk staff spoke decent English but it's a little out of town; it's a taxi into the Centre. There is a cinema complex across the street with some fast food restaurants and a shopping centre.

Stayed for the weekend for a fantastic rate. Our housekeeper, Ely was terrific. Immaculate room with all the amenities. Location is superb, close to restaurants and entertainment. Great linens, beds, and totally quiet. Will return.

The centralized location of this hotel made it idea for our exploration of beautiful Guadalajara and it's walking distance from many great restaurants (very safe).  We purchased the breakfast package as well and it was well worth it.  Not only do you get different restaurant quality breakfasts options daily, they have a person making omelets, eggs and all sorts of other goodies at your request.   The staff was friendly and efficient and was able to help us with anything we needed.  The person cleaning our room was very personable and was able to provide us with extra towels after only requesting once.  Some people have commented

Stayed for four nights at Krystal Urban Guadalajara: unbeatable location, excellent customer service, comfortable rooms, modern decor. We were going to stay for just one night, but we extended our stay one more night, then one more, then one more. The hotel is very comfortable, the room was the right size, and we had a room with a view of the city. The elevators broke down one time, but glad we were not in there when that happened. In my opinion, the restaurant was pricey so I decided to go to a small cafeteria around the corner. What cost MXN$255 at the hotel, I paid MXN$45 at the cafeteria, so their prices are insane.
