Excellent location in a very nice area of Guadalajara. Short distance to many good places. Rooms are incredibles and The service was really good, people always smiling and trying to help. Accesible prices for a hotel of this category  Great place to stay! Definitely I will come back

Very nice hotel, building, service, I think the hotel have 3 elevators, 2 for guests 1 for service, but service and 1 for guests were out of order, so you can imagine, still planning be back there again next time...

Many thanks to Gabriela the quality manager and Brenda the front desk clerk, you have been giving personalized and natural service which was happily received by us! We enjoyed the perfect location to bars, mall, restaurants and sightseeings! Great job and many thanks. We will chose you again when we are back in Guadalajara!    Also breakfast buffet was nicely set up and the gym modern equipped! Well done!

Vey nice hotel and service. Courteous staff. Cleanliness is important here. The restaurant inside the hotel is pricey and should have better prices. Would book through this hotel again. No problem. Very helpful staff.

I stayed here whilst on a business trip to Guadalajara and to be honest we selected it for proximity to the office I was working at, however boy did we luck out.  This place was excellent.   The staff here are really friendly and more than happy to speak in the language of your choice, even if it's a really poor imitation of the real thing (My Spanish is not of world class standards, to say the least).  The room I stayed in was spacious and at the top of the building had a really beautiful view over the city of Guadalajara.    Facilities wise I lacked for nothing, the bed was super comfy and really quite extravagantly large, the bathroom sparkling clean with plenty of hot water (and included some good quality consumables) and with plenty of soft clean towels, there was great

Very nice modern and clean rooms with great views.  Very good location right infront of a shopping center and different restarurants and bars.  However even that i was in the 10th floor i could hear the music from the bars accross the street.  Friendly and helpfull staff.

For what we needed it was the perfect location since everything was within walking distance. The staff was also very nice, except for the night shift waiter in the little bar they have, he didn’t seem very interested in helping us, everyone else was super nice! My biggest issue was how uncomfortable the bed and pillows were, even the little chair they had in the room was really hard. Also there are no windows you can open, I had trouble breathing due to the altitude of Guadalajara and it was very annoying having to walk out of the resort because of this.

Best hotel in Guadalajara !! This is my third time staying there an every time I get the same service .. food is great ! The staff is very helpful rooms are great .. I definitely recommend it they are doing a great great job !

We were very happy with our stay in this hotel.  We had a very comfortable king size bed with excellent linens.  The staff was very friendly and helpful. The neiborhood was great and we had two fabulous dinners nearby.  Casa Bariachi is so much fun with the best Mariachis I have ever heard and great Molcajetes.  Bruna Restaurante was a short walk and was one of the most beautiful restaurants I have seen along with great food.  I had a great pork shank there.  The neiborhood is full of great restaurants within a short walk and the hotel is excellent, I highly recommend along with the two restaurants.

We stayed 3 nights in March 2019. This was our first visit to Guadalajara, and based on the reviews of Historical Center hotels indicating iffy surroundings after sunset we chose this neighbourhood, and did not regret. Felt safe all the time walking to many restaurants and bars in the area. Historical center was 70-100 pesos taxi ride away, not a big deal. The hotel itself is more for business people oriented, but has all the anemities what an occasional traveller needs. We required a quiet room and was allocated a room without street view, but a  window to the central atrium. Very quiet indeed. Room/bed/bath were comfortable and impeccable clean.  Good breakfast including egg station where omelets etc were made to order. Very friendly and helpful staff. The business center has

The food, the room decor and appointments, and the maid service were superb.  What was most outstanding was the front desk staff.  Rene and Diego spent over an hour saving me from an error on the part of the airline which would have prevented my timely return home and cost me a lot of money. I will always stay at Krystal Urban when I am in Guadalajara.

This is a small tower hotel ideally located for those who want to stay in a place between downtown Guadalajara and other places to the southwest of the city, including of course Zapopan. The service is great, the rooms are modern, clean, well-lit and with good air-conditioned systems. The buffet service for breakfast has everything you need to start your day with good energy. The hotel is located in a calm and secure neighborhood, so it’s good if you enjoy talking walks. In front of the hotel you will find Centro Magno, a small shopping center where you can find restaurants, cinemas, and shops.

First time in Guadalajara and I can say I really enjoyed my stay at the Krystal Urban Guadalajara. They allowed me to check-in early and the service from the maids to the front desk was amazing! The hotel is centrally located and offers FREE parking!  Highly recommended if you are visiting the city. Will stay here again when I plan my next visit.

Excellent hotel, the location is perfect, service is very good and the rooms are quiet and perfect to relax. The price will depend base on the activity on the Expo Gdl but normally the price is pretty reasonable for what you get

It was our first visit to Mexico and Guadalajara and we stayed in the Junior suite for 10 days. The location is close to some of the best restaurants in the city. The staff at the reception, cafeteria and housekeeping were very helpful. Special mention for the reception staff who provided good information on places to visit and also helped us in making some reservations as we do not speak Spanish. Excellent stay at the Krystal Urban and having very welcoming and trained staff makes such a good impression not only or the hotel but they are brand ambassadors for their country as well when they welcome foreign travelers. Gracias and will be back to stay in Krystal Urban Guadalajara and their other properties when we travel to Cancun and other cities in Mexico. Good job Krystal

I found the staff super-friendly and keen to help. Modern hotel with comfortable rooms and nice bathrooms. 25 minute walk in a dead straight line to the cathedral. There were some issues with my room - no internet ever and no hot water on one morning. The charming front desk manager moved me to a 12th floor suite and was very apologetic

The hotel had a very modern look just as you see in their pictures. The staff was very good. The hotel restaurant can improve. The room was spacious and it was decorated very modern. The location was nice (it is not Avenida Chapultepec, but it was good), it had a mall right in front of it and a very nice restaurant nearby (Casa Biriachi, the restaurant has shows while you have your dinner).   PROs: good price, spacious room, modern  CONs: hotel restaurant needs to improve food quality

A shopping center is located in front of the hotel which was very  Convenient. Have a great view of the city from my balcony.  Lighting in lobby is low which was not the Best for me.  The 6th floor had a terrible smell in the hallway

We originally booked an Airbnb in Zapopan. We checked out a day early because it was giving me major OCD as it was dirty and grimy. Not a diva but am OCD when it comes to where I’m going to shower and sleep. Krystal looked beautiful online so gave it a shot. This place was spotless, beautiful and service was great. We wanted to go for a day drink specifically a beer the Morning we were checking out and the girl at the front desk stored our luggage and recommended Heidis a small German outdoor brunch place, just around the corner walking distance. we had a great time!

One of the best hotels in the area.  Excellent customer service, central location and close to shopping and great restaurants, and nightlife.  It was great to be able to stay here and travel to different locations through Guadalajara and other areas.

All the people you encounter right from the front desk such as Juan, Rene, Diego, Andrea etc are all friendly, communicative, helpful. Stay there for a week, the people working there are the best! No matter where you encounter the staff, dinning area, kitchen, elevator, hall way, they all give a Hola greeting with smile, and chat with you even with limited English. Whenever I come down to the lobby for some water, they all very kind to help you out from the kitchen. Just stayed here for four days for our my first visit to  Guadalajara. This hotel is just a perfect place to stay. The neighborhood is super; walkable and so conveniently located in the city. Across the street from the hotel in one direction there is a high end mall with a big Starbucks, and then a hipster three story container bar and restaurant complex across the other corner, and then banks, bars and restaurants that are so fabulous all within walking distance or a short Uber ride away. The hotel itself is just the best! Well decorated and planned, with excellent staff and customer service, we loved our time here and will definitely return. The hotel has a great location if its close to where you need to go of course, which it was in my case. Took me about 20 min to get there from the airport. They have free parking garage underneath the hotel wich was great because it was raining and there is an elevator to take you to the lobby. The hotel and room itselft was clean and spactious. It had an empty dorm sized fridge for your own drinks. The bathroom was excellent and the beds were comfortable. The curtains shut all the way so even with a view of the street the light didn't bother us at all. There is a shopping mall across the street, about 20 restaurant/bars and sever convenience stores really close to the hotel. I will stay there again next time in the GDL. Excellent city but unfortunately it rained quite a bit

Just what you need when you visit Guadalajara, the hotel is clean and staff is friendly and helpful. Carolina is very helpful and professional. Close to a lot of places of interest and restaurants. Will go there next time

Amazing place!! Great prices and staff was amazingly friendly and helpful. Accesible and convenient location. Highly recommend this place I look forward to returning in the near future. Clean and sanitized during this hard times

Unfortunately only one elevator was working. Also the service at the breakfast was not super perceptive and very slow. Also the rooms are very dark and facing inside. Apart from that hotel has a good location and big rooms!

Fantastic location, close to the best areas in GDL. As soon as we arrived to our room, surprise!!!  No electricity!!  Had to call maintenance to fix it, the ver next day, same thing again. I had to shower with the light of my cell phone. I tried to use the iron and never worked, called the lobby and I was ignored! In a few words: I will never return to this hotel. Better places in less than a two blocks and cheaper

I Book Krystal Urban Guadalajara because i was looking a hotel very well located, near to "Glorieta Minerva" So this is only 5 minutes away by foot.   I get surprise with the staff, they are really helpful and professional. Food is good, and the room is more tha you ca expected for the price. The view to the city is really nice.  I really recommend this place.

This hotel is the best combination of trendy (stylish modern decor) and comfortable (soft bed, spacious rooms with lots of amenities). Nice calm atmosphère in the city. The service is fast and good. Martin, the bellboy, was especially helpful and professional!  Location is ideal (quiet enough area, with trees and cycle path with cafés, shop and loads of restaurant around).  I personally wasn't a fan of there coffee at breakfast, they only serve weak filtered coffee in the morning, But they have a good coffee bar with espressos, limited hours though...

The hotel staff is absolutely wonderful. Everyone was very helpful and welcoming. Bellhop Martin was incredibly attentive. He was always right there to assist us, no matter how busy. He made us feel at home and greets guests with a kind smile.   The room was comfortable, spacious and clean. We also enjoyed our meals at the onsite restaurant. Thank you to the entire Krystal Urban team!

Friendly staff, good food, super comfy beds.  Good location in business district.  Very helpful porter, Martine, recommended restaurants and tours.  Staff went above and beyond to return clothes I had left behind, by Fed Rx shipment to my current location.  I would definitely stay there again.

This is my 3rd time staying at this hotel.  Staff is very kind welcoming. They jump at all your needs and make sure your stay is great. Yes one of the elevators was under construction but that is understandable  and it was not such a big deal. We managed. This hotel is very safe and your belongings are also very safe. Clearly there's room for improvement but it was a great stay.

Great Hotel, clean, big rooms and really good mattresses great for a good rest. The location is perfect and very secure. Love that there’s a mall just across the street. The staff great customer service. Definitely coming back!

Location is ok close to the Minerva fountain. In front of the street there is a small mall. Parking in the premises.

Overall the hotel is in good shape. Love the room. We had a little situation with AC, but it was fixed. Beds and pillows are great. Staff friendly and ready to help in our needs. Room service helpful. The whole area is nice and it is close to downtown and the clinic I am working with. Love it!

Omg... this is my second time staying in this hotel. The service is excellent and the breakfast is amazing. Please try their “molletes “. Best location and amenities were great. Next time for sure we'll book again, the crew was awesome during our visit. The plus is the quick access to the downtown, restaurants and offices nearby.  Fully recommended.

The Laffayette Hotel is located in the business district and with in walking distance of down town.  The rooms are nice, the staff is particularily agreeable and welcoming and the food is completely adequate.  The bar has entertainment every night for a coupld of hours which is very nice.  They also make the best Michelades I've found in a long while.    The hotel has a parking garage for persons with vehicles and tours will pick up at the front door.  It isn't fancy but it is friendly, clean and very reasonable and well worth the consideration.

Just stay one night, but really liked it. Good service,STAFF is really nice, I  liked the room, it's big enough, cozy, and very clean. The location was excelent because you have Av. Chapultepec just at the corner.

I spent three nights at this hotel and in the end I was happy to leave. To mention the pluses:  - friendly staff (reception, room service) - good location (close to street with vibrant nightlife and restaurants, not too far from the historic city centre) - price for accommodation ok  But the minuses override the pluses: - price for breakfast too hight for value - rooms need serious renovations (carpet smelly, windows single class, bathtub leaking, strong smell due to bad drainage) - if the hotel is fully occupied, calculate an extra 15min to catch the elevator downstairs - very slow internet connection in some rooms  Ask for a room with fast WIFI (usually xx06-xx09) if you need it.

We stayed here (rm 1406) March 11 2013 because it is just a couple blocks from the US Consulate (obtaining visa). Good service, comfortable beds.  In need of thorough renovations. Lobby and bar in good shape but rooms and halls battered and worn out.  Had to call for new batteries for TV remote. Prompt followup. Had to checkout late and front desk allowed us to store baggage from an hour or so.

Have stayed here a lot over the years. The location is great for night life, restaurants, and is central to the city.  Easy in and out. Shabby, YES.  Tired YES.  Fair price and well located, that's why we return.   Has valet parking which we like, then walk or cab around town.  Read a review saying no Internet.  This is NOT TRUE.  Wireless in all rooms.  We often return.

I was a little nervous after reading some of the previous reviews of Laffayette Hotel in Guadalajara, but the staff was tremendous!  I took a red-eye from Seattle to GDL and arrived at 5:10 a.m. and took a taxi to the hotel, worried that check in is 1:00 p.m. and that they would try to charge me an additional night.  No problem, I received my room at 6:00 .am. with no additional charges and I slept like a baby.  The rooms are not soundproofed as well as newer constructed hotels, but what do you expect for $50.00 a night.  llenty of restaurants nearby and a great spot to stay if you have business at the Consulate as I did.  Also much of the staff had understandable English skills.

The staff was friendly and knowledgeable, off street parking is free in their garage, and the price was great. The rooms where dirty, just 1 plug, internet service was very bad. Hallways were very muggy and the carpet in the rooms was dirty. Bed was very uncomfortable, and the cleanness of the room spike my allergies.

Location is absolutely great, very central, in my favourite part of Guadalajara where you can find many beautiful small restaurants, cafes and bars. So, I needed a hotel that was close to the U.S. embassy, that was the only thing this hotel had in favor.   Hotel needs a serious paint job on the outside. I don't recommend the hotel...

This is definitely not a good hotel to stay for business.  Goods: Location (if you are going to the US consulate) Friendly Staff  Bads: Breakfast too expensive. I would say abusively expensive Worst internet ever. if you need to work do not stay on this hotel. the pictures of the hotel are either way to old or they are fixed. the hotel needs a complete renewal. Service is bad, hotel does not have enough personnel. Rooms are not available by 3pm and it can take up to 2 hours for you to get a room. Parking is limited and to park is a big problem. Restaurant has bad service. Dirty tables, waiter takes forever to take your order and to give you a table. Great location but it gets really loud.

I should have suspected something when the staff insisted that I pay for my full stay upon check-in.  Another red flag waved when I had to sign a promisory note to pay 250 Mexican pesos if I didn’t return the television remote control at check-out.   I hadn’t lodged at the Laffayette Hotel in Guadalajara, Mexico for many years, even though I travel to the city several times each year.  I stopped staying there more than a decade ago because the physical plant had deteriorated due to lack of maintainance. If you're visiting Guadalajara and you are doing bussiness at the Expo Guadalajara, this hotel is great because is cheap, clean and is just a half block from the Chapulepec avenue where good pubs and bars are.

It’s my first time with you and I was amazed with the place, great service in every single aspect, everything was so clean and organized!!  I’ll recommend you to all my friends and family that will be going to Guadalajara!  Thanks to everybody that we’re so nice to us!!  Will come back very soon!!  Congratulations!!

Cozy hotel close to many amenities. Clean, safe and good service In the center of Guadalajara You can walk the nearby Boulevard Good and affordable rates  Excellent for a quick trip with no hassle for room

It was not bad for the price. Location cannot be beat though so adds to the hotel's worth. Nothing fancy at all but rooms were comfortable enough and good service. I would recommend this for someone who wants to be near the center but more in the local hang outs. Very safe area.

Picked this hotel because it is very close to the U.S. consulate. Very friendly staff and rooms very average..didn't  spend much time there but enjoyed the location..many restaurants close by..very thin walls and hard beds ...would stay again if needed to.

The location of the hotel is perfect, just a few blocks away from major avenues. You can find different places to walk around. It was a business travel for me I found everything I needed in the hotel, the staff was very nice and helpful. If you have your breakfast included, try it, it's very complete and delicious!

I made a reservation a week before arriving to Guadalajara for a business trip. We arrived at the hotel this morning and they acted like we were crazy and they basically kicked us out. Insanely rude. I DO NOT recommend this overated hotel and if you dare to make a reservation, pray you don't end up like us.

I stayed here for a work visit, and my hosts chose the hotel for me. After reading all the negative reviews on TripAdvisor I was really nervous about staying here. It was fine. Absolutely fine. DONT EVER STAY IN THIS HOTEL...the street is better. The room smells. They don't change the covers of the beds and you can smell cigar and cigarettes. The floor is dirty. Please look other places in Guadalajara. This hotel is defined not even close of an option for me

I had a very pleasant experience great location,  nice hotel y awesome staff. for sure I will come back and recommend it  to may family and friends. the rooms are clean and so the bathrooms. The dinning area is nice and the food is ok

happen to find this jewel on hotels.com and I gave it a try,  it is by far the best hotel in the area, super clean, super friendly staff, it is all above and beyond on what is currently available in the area. starbucks is a couple of blocks away (if you are on business) plaza del sol Mall with all its amenities, pharmacies, restaurants, etc  the room exceeded my expectations, just a little fixable issue with the TV disconnecting itself but that was all. highly recommended- will stay there from now on

I was very surprised and impressed by this hotel! A bit modest on the outside but very stylish and comfortable as soon as you step in. The staff was very friendly and attentive. There is a large, beautiful and very comfortable living-room style lounge that I had the pleasure of enjoying while working on my laptop. The beds are very comfortable, I slept like a baby. If you are looking for an alternative to the soulless mega-chain hotels, I highly recommend this locally-owned and operated gem.

Check in was fast easy even with my limited Spanish. The Hotel is tucked away in a nice quite neighborhood. Even though Plaza Del Sol is just a 5min. walk away. PDS is a hub of the city with many bus stations and stores to people watch. The First Class Hotel is truly beautiful. Very modern and we received great service. The staff at the hotel were very kind and helpful. We will definitely stay at this hotel again. We have no complaints. We really enjoyed our stay!

The only thing negative that i can say is that it takes approx. 10 minutes for the hot water to come on. the shower has light on the center that turns red when hot water is running, kind of neat. i called the front desk and they checked and related that the heaters were on. and maybe it had to do w/ the remodeling on the last floors? the noise from the remodeling was not bad, i hardly noticed it.  i would definitely stay at this hotel again, great price and quality.

Excellent service. Awesome friendly Professional hotel staff. Great hotel. Feels like home. Clean fresh rooms. Great security fingerprint to access room. Close to shopping plaza. Highly reccomended to anyone visiting Guadalajara.

Wanted a smaller quite hotel off the busy city. This was it. Great staff! Lovely building new everything. But seriously  great staff front desk fantastic valet great! We will be back. I just parked our car and used über everywhere.

We stayed at this new beautiful hotel. The service was great. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean. The rooms are decorated very modern and it was all very beautiful. We enjoyed our stay and will return to this hotel next time

I really enjoyed my stay at First Class Hotel. The room is generally bigger than other hotels nearby and the decor is up there vs the major chain like Hilton or Westin. The staffs there are very very attentive and willing to help us and accommodate our needs. This is my favorite hotel in Guadalajara.

The rooms are extremely comfortable and modern. And the doors open with your fingerprint!! The bed was soft and comfortable, and the service was good. Friendly people. The location is near a shopping mall, which was convenient.

I have stayed at this hotel twice now where both times I arrived late evening. Both times, the staff was extremely and helpful. Both times they offered me to pick up a meal from a near by restaurant or from their "closed" kitchen and they got exactly what I wanted very quickly. The rooms are beautifully appointed, great size and they even offer a common living room where every night is movie night on a big screen. They have a pool and a lovely restaurant. Highly recommend. 5 star service!

Our family of four occupied one of the presidential suites. Hint: Always ask for discounts/promotions when checking in. We took a look at the room prior to booking it. The room was great, comfortable with jacuzzi and view to the pool. Staff was wonderful!  One of the negative things was the sofa bed, my kids slept there and complained the mattress was too hard. Check to make sure who ever sleeps there is comfortable. The outdoor pool was nice and warm. They have movie nights, great for family:) parking available and walking distance from the mall. Oh and if you have kids, there is McDonals two blocks away.

Yes, it is true that this property is under renovation; it's true that somehow their just new rooms have a smell that is related to the paint and new furniture.   BUT..the hotel is Modern, centrally located in a good neighborhood, the employeeds are well trained, the price of the rooms is fare for their luxury.   AND..the management will walk the extra mile to make felt good.   As a personal experience I put a telephone call to te United States that was supposed to be the first 5 minutes free and the rest at a certain fee. The next day when I asked for my bill I was told the whole call was free as courtesy of the hotel. Time of the call was more than 50 minutes!

I'm sitting in my Plaza Diana room at this moment. Nothing old and smelly about this place. Everything here seems new and elegant. My rate for two nights, Sunday and Monday was much less than I would expect for the value received. I just walked up to Av. La Paz and over to  Banco Santander on Av. Vallarta. Great neighborhood, lots of great eateries and points of interest. This is my first time in Guadalajara and It is one of the finest cities I have visited worldwide. Sincerely, Dr. Joel E. Wright

The hotel offers a friendly welcome and a good location, but rooms are outdated and their upcoming remodel is much needed. A good place for a stopover, which is what I used it for. Free newspaper and internet were offered.

This could become a good hotel. Right now the rooms are old and smelly. They are in the process of renovating. They have an airport shuttle although at first they said they didn't have one. I guess they were not prepared. Only stayed one night and that was enough.

Rooms are nice, clean and recently remodeled. Bathroom sinks are not good as they do not drain.  Food is good and they bake their own bread  Fairly priced  Very small parking but they make do with the valet. But your car will always be hot as it does not have a roof

Centraly locate. The rooms are very clean and well appointed.  Friendly staff and great food in the restaurant. Priced right.  A very good value for the money.  I highly recommend this hotel.  Many of the cities sites are a comfortable walking distance away.

My husband and I stayed here for 5 days for a business conference.   What I enjoyed about this hotel is its proximity to downtown (20 minutes taxi ride, 70 pesos), close to two convenience stores, and most importantly, the friendly staff.  Even though many of them speak little English they were very helpful and hardworking.

I came for a convention and thios was the asigned hotel. the rooms are renewed and quite nice and they have a great breakfast. other than that, the conference rooms are poor and certainly not recomended.

We enjoyed our time at the Plaza Diana Hotel in Guadalajara, Mexico from March 30 to April 5.  The service, hospitality, cleanliness, and food were all of high quality;  we would definitely recommend this hotel to our family and friends!  Congratulations on a job very well done!  Muchos gracias !!!  :D

The room is much more bigger than some business hotels and location is very convenient to visit downtown or going for shopping to different malls.  I fully recommend it!!!

This hotel took unauthorised payment from my credit card for a meal that I had not signed for, after my check out! Later they agreed they they couldn't do this and would refund the amount, but never did and stopped replying to my emails. Irresponsible, devious and illegal. Breakfast was terrible with the worst live music ever. Seedy atmosphere in reception during evenings due to "working girls" visiting clients. Absolutely not recommended

We come to Guadalajara frequently and have been staying here for a couple of years. The renovation is wonderful. The rooms are really nice comfortable beds big towels and sunny rooms. The staff is friendly and always willing to help. However the best part is breakfast, wonderful food and service.  I really do not recommend dinner or lunch it takes a long time and there is great food in the city.

I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel. Staffs were extremely helpful, despite non English speaking. Facility also good for the fair price. There were shops and pharmacy nearby and lies in a very strategic location. Would love to stay again if I have chance.

I have stayed at Plaza Diana many times over the years and I don't think I will be back. The price goes up and up, the rooms are not as clean and the staff a little less friendly than in the past. Pros: nice restaurant w/great breakfast buffet. Bar open  5 to12pm allows smoking, friendly barkeeper. On the bar menu is a pizza for $90 pesos. Best deal ever, feeds 3 people, easy. Cons: 1. For a quick business trip. This is a very good option. Rooms clean and updated. The food at the restaurant is decently priced and good quality. In the Morning buffet they even have some live music! The location, one block, from the Minerva monument is perfect.

I stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights and considering the discount rate I got I can include it among the best quality-price rated hotels of central Guadalajara. Yet, I have a complaint about the payment. When making the reservation I specified I would pay cash on arrival at 3pm. But the hotel tried to charge my credit card immediately after finalizing the reservation. My luck was that I used a coded credit card that does not allow billing unless a code is sent through cellphone, so they could not charge my card. Politically correct hotels should respect the client's request to pay cash upon arrival (at least until 6 pm); and even more if they include on their webpage the option "pay on arrival". Apart from that, the hotel is comfy, nice and well-located.

First time at this hotel, you can tell that Is fully renovated, great customer service, the food was excellent and the location was unbeatable! great value! good deal. Without hesitation next time in Guadalajara I will book Hotel Plaza Diana!

For a short weekend stay it is perfect, well located and accessible. Rooms are nice and modern, clean and spacious, with good taste in decoration.  As for a week+ long stay, there are some amenities missing from a standard business hotel, that are reflected on the price.  The restaurant in place and room service are not reliable. And this shows when there is no coffee maker or mini bar in the rooms. The restaurant service is slow, and they are careless when taking orders and delivering them.   They are most of the time short in staff, so it may take a while to get your car from the valet parking, check in or store your luggage. This compensates with free services like Wi-Fi and parking. It's well located, and a good price.  Honestly it's nothing to look at from the outside but it's a business class hotel and it delivers on that.   The only complaint I have with it is that the showers are sub par. What should be a quick shower can take a long time as the water pressure and temperature control is horrendous.

First of all...dont judge a book by its cover.. this place might not look that great from the outside but inside it is beautiful... the room was big and very, very clean. I loved my room it was nice, clean and beautiful. The staff was awesome as well, great customer service, all of them were very nice people. My luggage was lost in the airport, and the hotel receptionist was very willing to help get me the phone numbers as to where to call and get status on my luggage. The location is not bad, its close to lots of places where you can eat or shop if you need something. Room service was great, good warm food, fair prizes and on time. Overall this was a wonderful place and I would definately go back. =)

I was very happy with my stay regarding the price I paid. Good:  - near the center (10 min on foot) and near a subway station - super clean  - parking - good internet - Restaurant in the hotel ( can be handy) Bad: - none Other: The bed was hard but it was ok for me.

This hotel is unattractive on the outside, but surprisingly nice on the inside. It has obviously been remodeled recently. The decor of hotel is very nice and has a clean appearance.  The price is reasonable. The staff is very pleasant and helpful. The location is convenient as it is close to the city center.  Negative  aspects would be that our room was along a busy street and near a night club. On one of the nights we heard loud music from midnight until about 5 am. This was quite disturbing. Also, the hotel is along a one-way street and the parking is limited. I had to give my car keys to staff in order to move the car if needed.

My daughter and I stayed at this hotel and our room looked exactly like the brochure.  It was well appointed and clean.  It is a bit of a walk to the Cathedral but a taxi is only $30.00 pesos and the staff will procure one.  We had a continental breakfast and the fruit plate was very nice.  The 'pan dulce' or coffee cake was one of the best I have ever tasted.  Take your own wash cloth, but the large walk-in shower is excellent.

I didn't actually stay here, but did have an occasion to stop in for some help trying to find a hotel that accepted dogs.  The young woman at the desk (I unfortunately did not ask her name) went beyond great service in calling a hotel she knew was dog friendly, reserving a room for us, verifying the price, and printing out a map.  Another thing I can say about this hotel is that it does have a great location, very near the main cathedral and the center of town.  We were there on Sunday afternoon, it was very fun, lots of shopping and activity.  This hotel also has parking available.

Hotel is within walking distance of U.S. Consulate, the main cathedral, other beautiful sites and the famous market.  It is also close to the restaurant Fonda de San Miguel the most romantic restaurant in Guadalajara---with excellent food.  Staff is very helpful.  Special thanks to Mario (bell person), Anna and Nancy (front desk) and Sofi (maid).  The staff was helpful with directions and recommendations.  Free parking and wi fi make it just about perfect.  Would definitely stay here again.

The staff are very friendly, and I was really happy with my stay.  I would most definitely recommend staying at Hotel Casino Plaza in Guadalajara.  They offer great competitive pricing without compromising service or how clean everything is in the hotel and/or rooms. The rooms are very big, clean, and the whole hotel smells nice. The food is was great and priced very competitively.   I actually liked the eco-friendly concept of the hotel rooms.  When you left your room and took your key out of the power slot, all power to the room would shut down. This meant that the air conditioning also shut down.  Once back in the room, it only took the air conditioner a few minutes to cool the room down again.  I think it is a really responsible approach to our ecosystem and appreciate their

My family and I decided to stay here because the location was just perfect for us. Everything was going just fine until the night. My mom said that she was hearing some noise from we believe were the drainage piping on the walls. The second night I was watching a movie at 2am and had the oportunity to hear those sounds too. Just fix that.  Delicious food at the restaurant and everyone were so great.

This hotel is convenient to downtown, with spacious, clean rooms and a friendly staff.  However, after traveling for business for 25 years and staying in many hotels, I have never spent a less comfortable night on any hotel bed in my life.  I stayed in room 601, and the bed was awful.  It felt like there was a bag of rocks under the mattress.  The flimsy pillows weren't much better.  It's a shame, because everything else about the hotel was above average.  But let's face it, the reason we go to a hotel is to get a good night's sleep, and unfortunately, the Casino Plaza did not give me one.  I also asked for a quiet room, but was given one on the street side, which was far from quiet.  Quite a bit of traffic noise woke me more than once.

I got the Hotel Casino Plaza on a 3rd party site, based on stars and price and being close to Centro.  Stayed in room 406 for 3 nights this past week.  The pictures on all the sites portray it accurately, as far as room decor.  The funny flowers, as décor in the rooms and hallways, were everywhere.  Made me smile.  The dark wood doors within the unit gave it a sense of elegance, against the white tile floors.  The hotel and my room were extremely clean.  Bed was comfortable.  Pillows a bit too hard for my tastes.  The TV was only in Spanish.  I may have been the only gringa there at the time, although the staff members speak some English and were friendly and helpful.  The wifi worked without a hitch.  That was important to me as my hotels for the previous two weeks provided no

The Hotel is around 10 - 15 minutes from the Plaza and Catedral. Mainly a Mexican Business Hotel, never saw a foreigner in the 3 days I was there. There is a simple Restaurant on the second floor open all day.

Only stayed the one night but room was very nice and clean. Restaurant food was very good and reasonably priced. Within walking distance of the Expiatory Temple. Staff very helpful and friendly, would stay again.

This hotel is near the Templo Expiatorio and the Bellas Arts museum, just to name two great sightes within walking distance.  Hotel is new and contemporary.  Staff is very friendly and helpful.  Free self-parking garage.

This hotel was just incredible great staff, the restaurant food was awsome and they have exellent prices, near everything in Guadalajara very nice and clean. The staff was incredible I will stay there any time I visit Guadalajara. Walking distance from all the important places a beer bar just in the corner, and they have taxis all the time I feel very safe in this hotel. Especial thanks to Daniel from front desk great service. For me the best place to stay.

All you need is there. Very good location, walking distance of downtown and feet away from Juarez intermodal subway station. Very clean and well furnished. Very good staff too. I will definitely return as soon as possible. The internet was also perfect. Only lacking more lighting in the desk area and an alarm clock.

A very nice, very clean, well-furnished place to stay in downtown Guadalajara, near the university. Inside rooms are very quiet. Staff was very helpful and attentive. Within walking distance of all downtown sights.  Highly recommended.

This hotel is a ridiculously good value.  The clean rooms have all the business/tourist hotel ecoutrements -- huge flat screen, high thread count sheets, cranking AC, nice bathroom, safe, etc  Somehow the price is uber-competitive.  It's so cheap I am contemplating living there for a couple of months this summer!  Could not be more central:  it's in a happening nightlife area, next to metro and a park and the University.  The street scene is 100% more inviting than the scuzzy area closer to the Cathedral.  Big winner in my book.

We enjoyed our stay at this very friendly hotel. The door-man is very helpful and he turned out to be the service /repair guy as well. Nice receipt and the rooms were excellent. Nice bathroom, beds and perfectly working WIFI. The hotel is located next to the gay area where we know all the bars and disco's. Nice small restaurant for a quick and well priced breakfast. Will certainly be back at this hotel!

Went with my family. Got the triple bed room, which was perfect for the 4 of us. Price was $55 a night. Clean, spacious, and beds were comfy. In Mexico, comfy beds are hard to find. WiFi was on par by Mexico standards. Everyone was nice and helpful. Close to everything. Walk, bus or short taxi ride. Overall, great value near the historic area of GDL. Stayed in room 405 and 605.

This place is totally deserving of its positive TripAdvisor comments and i'm happy to throw another 5/5 review into the mix.  Excellent location, great staff, immaculately presented rooms and amenities. It's a complete gem and unbelievably cheap too.

the hotel is beautiful and really clean and the service he is excellent, the car park is inside quite big and secure, the buffet breakfast is highly recommend for the price. The only problem we found is to much noise from the bars close by, so if you can ask for the room in the back if you staying in the weekend, if no, trough the week is fine. good location

Hotel Casino Plaza is definitely one of the hidden gems in GDL......from the minute you arrive you are made to feel so welcome. Jose, with his wonderful knowledge of english and as well Mario help begin your relaxing, wonderful stay there. They both are great assets to the hotel. Always there to help whenever you need them. The girls at the front desk do everything to accommodate every need we had.....the rooms are roomy and clean and the beds just how I like them......(the only thing I could recommend is to use fitted bottom sheets, I wake up in a horrible mess every morning). I have stayed there several times and will continue to do so. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting GDL.

We spent only one night there. The rooms are clean. Everything you need is available. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is good. You can choose buffet or special breakfast. The price-performance is absolutely okay. The Casino Plaza is central located with restaurants and bars nearby.

I am on a two year vacation here in Mexico and have been to Guadalajara many times in the last eight months. I usually go for the best priced hotel as I am on a budget and only sleep in the room before spending the rest of my time exploring. This time, my parents flew down from San Diego to visit so I wanted them to be a little more comfortable. We spent four days at Hotel Casino Plaza and boy what a difference! I will never stay anyplace else in Guadalajara from now on. Awesome service, decent restaurant, very, very comfortable and spacious rooms. Beds, sheets, bathrooms, A/C, cable channels, maid service, cleanliness, all awesome. For the extra $15 a night I am used to spending, I  felt like I went from a pauper to a prince. Mario is great, he will help you find and do

for the price we paid for this room, I was very satisfied. everything was up to date and clean, the beds were comfortable, and it was fairly quiet. if you want to be near the historical center but not in the middle of all the noise, this is a good choice. it's also a very short walk to some lovely neighborhoods to the west with great cafes and restaurants. I will stay here again if I can get the same rate again (I paid roughly US$32/night for 2 people). another excellent option is the nearby Hotel Portobelo.

What a great place to stay!  The staff were wonderful.  Mario was a bellman was extremely courteous and helpful with showing us to our room and providing information about where to find certain places in town like a market. The accommodations were very nice, clean and modern.  The entire hotel seemed to be very well kept and taken care of.  The coffee, juices and breakfast in the restaurant were all very tasty.  The only thing that was not "great" were the hallways on the floors where the rooms are located.  Due to the tile hallways, it was a little noisy at times.  After 10pm or so it seemed like it settled down, but I always take earplugs when I travel and they came in handy.  This matter is somewhat out of the control of the hotel management and I would not let this prevent

I booked this hotel as part of a package, and I think it was a fairly inexpensive hotel. The hotel was more than sufficient for our four days in the city. My room was a bit nicer than my friends with a lot of space and a flat screen TV. Bed was comfortable, water was hot, Internet worked, what more can you ask for? Don't forget to check in on Facebook in the lobby for a free piece of amazing cake!

We absolutely love this hotel. This was our second time staying here and plan on making it a third for our next trip to Guadalajara. We’ve always had a very pleasant stay here. Great location. Cabs and public transportation all around. You’ll pass plenty of bars and restaurants. All kinds of shops, from clothing, to shoes, to beauty and skin care products, jewelry, gifts, books, coffee shops, etc. From the moment of check-in to check-out the staff was attentive and friendly. Daniel at the front desk has always been extremely responsive, communicative and went above and beyond throughout our stay. Our room was ready on time and looked great. The rooms are spacious, immaculate and comfortable and the bed area had plenty of outlets for charging phones, plus reading lamps. There are

The Room was very clean! For $29.00 a night I will have to give it Five Stars! The staff was very friendly and helpful!! Do wish it had a refrigerator in the room! There is secure parking .A convience store across the street.

We were a little taken back when we booked this hotel and the price... $29 per night.. WOW! Friends of ours had stayed here and loved it. Front desk clean and very friendly staff. Our room-exceptional clean nice comforts and excellent wifi. Plenty of hot water and this room had no view. But for $29 what did we expect... Hotel Casino Plaza had the comforts of home... it was clean with when asked for extra towels-immediately brought up to us. Front desk informative and very friendly. I would and plan to stay here again when in Guadalajara for business and or pleasure. Close to everything.

I spent a week at the Casino Plaza in late May and I heartily recommend it. The mix of Mexicans and English speaking guests was balanced. It is clean, and even though it was a great value, it had all the amenities (safe, satellite tv) that you would expect in a much more expensive hotel. The temperature outside was in the 90's and what I appreciated most was the individually controlled air conditioning unit. The second thing I enjoyed daily was the breakfast buffet. It wasn't included with my room price but was only 95 Pesos ($5 USD). They had an excellent variety every morning of five or six hot foods, fresh fruit and juices, cereals and pastries.Good coffee and a responsive kitchen staff. I believe the restaurant was exclusively for hotel guests and I even had a few dinners.

Location is ok, ~15 min walking to the cathedral. The room was very big, had a/c and was super clean. The staff is super attentive and go beyond themselves to help you. My only complain is that the wi fi signal is super poor in the rooms, to a point that you just can't use it. Overall very pleasant stay!

Hotel Casino Plaza is in a perfect location to explore Guadalajara. It's only ten minutes or so away from the Catedral and also nearby a gorgeous park and some really hip lounges. Only five minutes to the Templo and University.  The rooms were beautiful both the furnishings and furniture new and elegant and very clean. Service was wonderful.  The value of this hotel is excellent and will definitely stay here again next time we visit.

Great staff and location. Convenient to everything. If you need something there are lots of stores within walking distance. Rooms are clean, large and good A/C. Breakfast is good value. Would recommend to anyone traveling to the central part of Guadalajara.

Overall it was great! location close to everything! The host where fantastic especially Jose Moreno he was fabulous as to guiding us where and what to do he did an awesome job! It was wonderful! Very HAPPY because he got us da perfect prices to visit da special places in Guadalajara. I would recommend him anytime to anyone!! Next time I go back to visit I will go back to the hotel and to Jose Moreno so he can guide me to visit some other special places of Guadalajara!!   :)

I stayed here with a friend in late December 2016.  We had a room with two double beds, and the room was very clean, with good wifi.  The hotel staff were very helpful, reserving a taxi to the airport for me and giving me ice to help me with an injury (they were very sympathetic and encouraging).  There are cafes, restaurants and convenience stores close by (as well as a subway stop), making this a very convenient hotel.  Recommended for travelers who want a reasonably priced hotel with good basics.

This was my first time to Guadalajara and I was extremely impressed with this hotel. Wifi worked great and it was very clean. The cleaning lady always came around throughout the day to check on me and clean the room. Receptionists were always there to help with whatever you need! Jessica was a life saver... haha she assisted me from booking my room to getting to the hotel and finding my way around the city a couple times. I couldn't have asked for a better expereince. Also, the hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of anything you could need (especially food!)! I am already planning another trip to Guadalajara and will be starting here again! This time i will be staying for 2 weeks instead of 1 week!

Everything the staff did for me was superb.  Arranged an arrival pickup @ GDL airport, booked 2 other taxis for me with a great driver & all very reasonable.  They looked up bus schedules for me & called the hotel that I was next heading to for arrival info.  The room was clean as a whistle, everything worked, including a/c, WIFI, TV & plenty of hot water.  The restaurant food was so-so, but others may feel it was great.  I would definitely stay again.

I've stayed at the Hotel Casino Plaza a couple of times before, but the rooms have been upgraded and its now an even better value. We paid about US$50 with tax for a room with two double beds, and everything was just right. Great beds, very clean room, and good wifi. Feels like a more expensive hotel. I really like the location, as its right between the Centro Historico and the Chapultepec area. This is one of the better places to stay in Guadalajara, especially considering price, in my opinion. The windows are now double glazed, so noise was not an issue at all. However, I asked for a quiet room, and then put me in room 202.

4 nights in this lovely hotel. Lots of time and care in the decorating. High quality furnishings. Lobby beautifully decorated for Christmas, the staff is amazingly friendly...maids, waitresses, front desk, all. It is as clean and nice as many hotels in Guadalajara that cost double. There is a parking garage which is a big bonus, bar and restaurant on premises. The food was good especially considering the cost. I recommend this hotel,  just blocks from the Cathedral, lots of shopping and sights very close by.  For those who have never traveled to Mexico before, let me give you some basic tips that will make your trip a thousand times more enjoyable. 1. Waiters will not come and take your order if your menu is open. They don't want to rush you. 2. They also do not check on you

Hotel Casino was advised as a nearby recommendation by TripAdvisor that turned into a totally pleasant experience.. The rooms are beautifully detailed... the staff personable and accommodating. A look at the evening Buffet enticed us.. the rate was very fair and the location was convenient for a variety of Guadalajara experiences

Safe in room opens with room card, someone else also had a room card that opened the safe.  One of passport wallets that locks with a padlock was ripped opened - and we are now waiting to see if ATM and credit cards were skimmed.  The room itself was large, bed and pillows comfortable and there was ample furniture to use and lay items out.  What we did not like was the lack of any ledge or tray in the shower which meant everything went on the floor including soap as the soap dish was broke and turned upside down, towels in particular were threadbare delivered same way everyday, sheets and pillowcase were not sized for the bed (small), one only plug for bedside lamp without a second outleft for any phone or electronic device meaning you needed to unplug the lamp, only one other

Although small, this is a very nice hotel, impeccable, nice rooms and the attention of all personnel (front desk, cleaning ladies, bell boys) is excellent!!  I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to Guadalajara!  Thank you for everything!!

During my trip in Mexico I stayed in 6 different hotels in different cities and this one was the jewel of them all. It is well located, have a fair price, really confortable rooms (oh my god that bed) and the service is impecable. You can put your clothes to be taken to laundry there and it has a very good restaurant inside the hotel that is well worth your time. The people there are really helpful, can talk well in english with you and can inform you of whatever you need to know. The hotel has its parking lot, if you are on a car, and if you aren't, there is usually a taxi inside said parking lot at orders, which is very convenient if you are in a hurry. The only "but" I would have is regarding the wi-fi connection, which dropped sparingly. But it was extremely minor and didn't

I'm a one-legged deaf person who stayed at Hotel Casino Plaza. What a gem! The people are friendly and ready to help. The rooms are spotless and beautifully appointed. The Hotel cafe has excellent food. I ate an avocado, bacon omelette with tasty salsa and tortillas everyday for breakfast. The buffet is very popular. The Hotel is a tightly run ship. You can tell every employee knows their job. And the price of a room can't be beat. I suggest the sixth floor.  Venture through the safe, vibrant working-class neighborhoods and get a taste of real Mexico and rare tourists sightings. Two blocks away is Coltrane Cafe on a bohemian street with only foot traffic. Nurse a beer or cappuccino. While I was there stools were set up and a gentleman played Spanish guitar. (I couldn't hear it,

This was by far the best stay from all our stays in Mexico. Staff is very friendly and hospitable. The rooms were clean, comfortable beds and convenient to stores and attractions near by. I would rate this hotel a 10!!!!

We recently stayed at this hotel during our visit to Guadalajara.  It was a nice place to rest.  We spent most of the day with family and just stayed at the hotel overnight.  The bed was super comfortable and the room was always clean.   We had breakfast one morning at the restaurant on site.  The food was delicious and reasonably priced.  The staff at the hotel were very friendly.  I liked the location of the hotel because it is right in the heart of the city.  We could pretty much walk anywhere and the metro was very close by.  Overall it was a great stay and I would highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed for nine nights at the Hotel Casino Plaza. We weren't sure what to expect for the very reasonable price, but it is an excellent hotel. Very nice, clean rooms. Friendly, helpful staff. We had a very spacious room.   The location was perfect, within walking distance of a lot of tourist attractions, restaurants, and stores.    Wifi was reliable.   The only shortcoming was the restaurant. The food was not always the best at times but there are plenty of restaurants nearby.

Excellent hotel in between centro historico  and chapultepec . Lots to do around the hotel with parks restaurants cafés entertainment very safe lots of activity. A couple things that really caught my attention, The people at the front desk were very friendly and helpful!! Great Wi-Fi and hot water in the shower. If you are facing the main road there is a little bit of noise across the street from a bar on the weekends... but with a white noise app on your phone and the windows are pretty good it is not too much of a problem I highly recommend this hotel in Guadalajara especially for the price it cannot be beat!! .

We just returned from a 10 day stay at this hotel. It was just what we needed; a reasonably priced, well located, clean, attractive hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. It is a short walk to stores, restaurants and the tourist attractions. We would definitely stay there again.

Having been up and down all of Latin America for 3 decades now I can honestly you this is the best value and quality and service for a reasonable price I have found from Argentina north to Mexico.  If you visit GDL and want to be in the historic CENTRO area this is your best value.  Lovely spacious room, warm and friendly staff, a good restaurant on site with fair prices and a central location. I have been here over a month now for the cold winter months at home and have been very happy here. This is a real gem and with an amazing record for a non-major chain more boutique hotel.  Try it you should like it as well. OK

Hotel has great service. Safe and near the downtown area. The entire staff is helpful and very friendly. This is the second time we stay here, buffet is good and the dinner in good and very inexpensive. Beds and pillows  are comfortable and a very clean hotel.

My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights, we had been wanting to come to Guadalajara for sometime. The first thing you notice about the hotel is the super friendly and helpful staff. The facilities overall are very clean and neat, a bit dated but that did not bother us, I guess it's the theme of the city. The rooms are very clean and quiet, the bed very comfortable and comes with free water, and free wifi( very fast). Overall comfortable and for the price, you can't beat it. Would definitely recommend staying here to friends and family.

The hotel caters primarily to a business clientele and has a good location--away from the noise and bustle of downtown (currently dug up for  the construction of a new subway line) but close enough so that you walk there in 10 minutes. I had a very nice, spacious room for about $35 but the window overlooked one of the hotel corridors. As a result, there was no sunlight whatsoever and I couldn't tell day from night. The hotel withheld this crucial piece  of information at the time of reservation which reflects poorly on the way it  treats its guests. The other problem I encountered was in the form of hard pillows which made sleeping difficult. I asked for a soft pillow but was told  there were none. Overall, I had a good stay, despite these annoyances, and would recommend the

We have a very good stay in this hotel. The room is spacious and clean. Very short walk to the city center. A supermarket is nearby. Several restaurants and convenience stores around. But it would be a little bit difficult to take the bus to the bus terminal, better go there by taxi.

great staff, comfortable big rooms, good restaurant.  Close to sites, I was new to using a mobility cart and found this hotel easy to use.  But it is not handicap accessible because of the bathroom but I found it a easy place to be.

... but sadly disappointing. Pros: comfy bed, good water pressure in shower, well-maintained and clean room, friendly staff and decent location.  Cons: when we enquired about a taxi the lady at the desk informed us that we might be taken advantage of if we flagged a taxi. She claimed it would be better for her to call one for us. After waiting 30 mins for the taxi to arrive we got in and the driver went into the hotel (with money). When asked to start the meter the diver said "60 pesos" and, trusting the hotel staff, we agreed to the fare. The taxi fare back to the hotel was only 26 pesos. Hmmm.  Our first night was spent, pretty much sleepless, in a room on the nightclub side. While the room they let us switch to was quieter (except for the noisy pipes) it was in a wifi

I will have to say that being that I had not visited Mexico in decades this location had the best overall service I could have looked for.  The receptionists, the general manager, the wait staff, bell hops, to the housekeepers.  It was like I was surrounded by family and I could not thank them enough for such a positive heart-warming experience. I am grateful I choose this hotel.  The breakfast buffet has many choices, even for vegetarians!  I would definitely recommend  you get the package w/the breakfast included nothing compared to our buffets in the the states. It is well worth the money.  The tours offered at the front desk also are top of the line quality.    It is very centrally located and easy access to banks, convenience stores, and within walking distance to the

I booked the hotel while driving, and mostly got a room based on good reviews, and great rates, we had been driving all day and were fairly spent. When we arrived my expectations were low, I wanted a clean and quiet room. But when I walked in the door, I was wonderfully surprised with immaculate cleanliness and a very well appointed room. The bed was very firm and felt new. I could not believe that the rates were so low for such a nice room. Definitely would recommend!

Good location,clean, roomy and comfy rooms, extremely helpful employees at the reception area, good restaurant for mexican breakfast options in the morning, and good selection of domestic beer and tequilas at night, excellent price. The hotel is at a walkable distance from the most important places in the Guadalajara historic area (Catedral, Cabañas Museum, public markets,mexican restaurants, city Tours pick up places, jewrely center, plazas, etc.) From there you have access to most of the city historic places and can get rides to the surrounding areas tours.

I was happy with the small, cozy room, just like the picture and probably recently reno'd.  I asked for a quiet room and was pleased with the noise factor.  7 short blocks from the big Cathedral and the Plaza de Armas

Hotel Casino Plaza was an oasis in the middle of an, amazing, busy city.  The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The price was very inexpensive for the quality. Carlos at the front desk was so wonderful and helpful.  We ate breakfast both mornings in the hotel restaurant. Good food, good price, convenient.  We will stay there any time we are in Guadalajara.

Comfortable, good price and excellent location, near stores, theaters and others.  Air conditioning working, clean room. The staff is very helpful. It has a restaurant with variety of food.  Excellent service

we stayed 2 nights at this hotel which was recommended to us by previous guests. It did not disappoint!  Very clean, spacious, convenient location and staff were all very friendly and helpful. The front desk staff spoke very good English and were very helpful in providing information/directions, etc.

Very good location: no traffic noise, 10-15 minute walk to historic center, English speaking desk staff, large room, comfortable beds, English language TV programs.  Only drawback was hearing our neighbors talking in their room.

I stayed at this hotel for four nights last fall.  It was my second stay at this hotel, and I was not disappointed by the very kind and accommodating staff (especially since I was sick for part of my stay) and the clean but simple rooms.  The breakfast buffet was also very good as well.  We asked for and were given a quiet room, but I noticed that on my day of departure (I left very early morning on Saturday), that you could hear loud music in the hallways and lobby from a nightclub nearby.  Nevertheless, a very satisfying second stay at this hotel.

Nice hotel richly appointed with courteous and helpful staff and centrally located a few blocks from the central square.  We came earlier than we had booked for and were given a gorgeous suite with a large Jacuzzi for 100 pesos more and were allowed to stay for the remainder of our stay at the original booking price. Hotel is quiet and the room comes with a safe.  There is ample parking in the building very conveniently right by the lobby.  The restaurant was quite good, something we appreciated as there are not any good restaurants nearby that we were aware of.  I

We recently stayed at this hotel for 3 days, the room was big enough for 2 adults and 2 small kids (2 & $yrs old). We safely walk to downtown and to Mercado de Sn Juan, the front desk people gave us directions. We also visited Tlaquepaque and the people at the hotel made transportation arrangements for us for just $100 pesos (about $5US for a 25min ride) also a transfer to the airport for $250 pesos (less than $15US) Before to arrived to the hotel, I had some issues with my credit card and Jessica (reservations dept) was very helpful and kind, she assisted us everytime we called the hotel. Also Stefania and Elena at front desk were very helpful and professional. We had a good time during our stay, it is a nice and comfortable hotel with an excellent night rate and the excellent

Friendly staff who spoke English. The room was a little small, but perfect for the two of us. It was very clean. The bed was comfy. The shower had great water pressure. The location was good, an easy walk to Centro Historico. Highly recommended for the price.

First & most important the bed was great - a mattress with a memory foam top section which was very comfy. Great & clean sheets. Very large room with cable TV - many Spanish & some English channels. Lots of great eateries & many things in asking distance near by. We booked an airport pick up thru the hotel which is almost 3 times price of Uber but being first visit to Mexico & arrival at 1:30am were happy for the safety. After that we just used Uber which was very well priced.

This hotel was great for our Thanksgiving trip to Guadalajara. Be warned though, no casino ;)   The location was perfect, we were able to explore the city on foot, and even booked a day tour to Tequila through our hotel. Helpful staff, clean, comfortable rooms, great location, great value!

Although is near the historic center and the market, the very block where is located is not that safe, and there are not many things to do around. There’s a restaurant open from 7 am on and the food is good, nice breakfast and prices are reasonable.

A very nicely remodeled hotel a few blocks from the historical center of Guadalajara, Jalisco, Mexico. My room was very spacious with ample electrical outlets for charging all those devices we travel with now. The room and bathroom were very clean and well appointed. The TV was new and the AC worked very well as did the wifi. The staff is very friendly and helpful. If you are looking for a quiet, clean, safe and economical place to stay near the center of old Guadalajara, I would highly recommend this hotel.

$35 USD a night? What! No one believes us! Huge king bed, super clean hotel and room, large marble bathroom and walk in shower, easy to control A/C, nice front desk. We loved it!   Right between Centro and Americana so easy to walk to sights. Our first visit to Guadalajara and we could have stayed longer than 3 nights. Lovely town and great hotel. I'd skip the breakfast though. It was fine but dining room is quiet and dull, would walk down the street to many other choices.

Room is large and reasonably priced. Clean towels and quality bathroom amenities. Short walking distance to both Zona Central and Templo Expiatory. Breakfast buffet and a la carte menu have good offerings at fair price. The safe in our room needed service, and reception accommodated our request to move to another room. Room is partially sound-proof as we can hear talking in hallway if voice is raised.

We were pleased with the attractive and very clean room. The staff was friendly, helpful and polite. A park is close by, as is a convenience store. The only drawback was that our room faced the street, and there was a nightclub across the street with music until 1 am. Next time, we'll ask for a room on the other side of the hotel. The breakfast buffet, while not included, was very good. The centro is in walking distance. Compared to other hotels we have stayed at in Guadalajara, this is a good value. We would stay here again.

I've been in this hotel 3 times in the last 3 years and, in my experience, I can say that I was absolutely comfortable there. Clean rooms, efficient personnel and specially great people at the front desk. I would give them a shout out if I could remember their names.  There's a convenience store right across the street on the corner open 24/7 and some good small "delis" near by as well. Public transportation is very accessible there too.  Over all, this is a good option to stay in El Centro (down town).  Hi to everyone working there and I have the privilege to meet. Thanks!!

My family and I stayed at the hotel Casino Plaza for four days from 7/5- 7/9. The people are very friendly, courteous, and helpful. The rooms are super clean, big and very specious. We've stayed at a 4 star resort and this was way better than that resort. It was a very pleasant surprise when we walked into our rooms to see how nice and well maintained the room and furniture looked. It is centrally located and it is at walking distance to the cathedral and downtown Guadalajara.
